callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CGI 2025

## Conference Overview

COMPUTER GRAPHICS INTERNATIONAL 2025 (CGI 2025) will be held at **The Hong Kong Polytechnic University, Kowloon, Hong Kong**, from **July 14-18, 2025**.

CGI is one of the oldest annual international conferences on Computer Graphics in the world, dedicated to making it a top conference on graphics and media. Researchers are invited to share their experiences and novel achievements in various fields of Computer Graphics, Media, and Virtual Reality.

## Topics

The main topics of the CGI 2025 conference include, but are not limited to:

*   Rendering Techniques
*   Geometric Computing
*   Metaverse (VR/MR/XR)
*   Shape and Surface Modeling
*   Physically-Based Modeling
*   Computer Vision for Graphics
*   Scientific Visualization
*   Data Compression for Graphics
*   Medical Imaging
*   Computational Geometry
*   Image-Based Rendering
*   Computational Photography
*   Computer Animation
*   Visual Analytics
*   Shape Analysis and Image Retrieval
*   AI-Generated Content (AIGC)
*   Volume Rendering
*   Digital Cultural Heritage
*   Computational Fabrication
*   Image Processing and Analysis
*   3D Reconstruction
*   Global Illumination
*   Graphical Human-Computer Interaction
*   Digital Humans
*   Saliency Methods
*   Shape Matching
*   Sketch-Based Modeling
*   Robotics and Vision
*   Stylized Rendering
*   Textures
*   Machine Learning for Graphics
*   3DGS/NeRF-Based Rendering

## Important Dates

### The Visual Computer Journal Submission

1.  **Submission Deadline:** February 20, 2025
2.  **Preliminary Notification to Authors:** March 30, 2025
3.  **Revised Paper Submission Deadline:** April 20, 2025
4.  **Final Notification of Revised Papers:** May 15, 2025

### CGI Proceedings (LNCS Book), CAVW Journal, VRIH Journal

1.  **Submission Deadline:** May 4, 2025
2.  **Notification of Acceptance:** June 5, 2025
3.  **Revised Final Paper:** June 20, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Page Limit:** Please submit 8-12 pages.
*   **Format:** Papers should be submitted in PDF format. The PDF paper should **NOT** contain any name or affiliation (blind paper).
*   **Templates:** A template for the full paper submission is available in [Microsoft Word](http://www.cgs-network.org/cgi25/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/CGI2018_Word.zip) and [Latex](https://www.cgs-network.org/cgi18/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/CGI2018_latex.zip).
*   **Videos:** You may include videos in MP4, WMV and AVI format. For multiple videos, please use a zip file. The maximum file size is 40 MB per submission.

## Submission Tracks

*   **For the first call (Visual Computer track):** Submission deadline is **February 20, 2025**.
*   **For the second call:** Indicate your preferred publication track: either Proceedings Book, or VRIH journal, or CAVW journal. Submission deadline is **May 4, 2025**.

*Please note:* For the second call, the program chairs will make the final decision on which paper goes into the book or journals at the final stage.

## Submission Portal

Submit your paper via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cgi2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cgi2025)

summary: The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA 2025) will be held on October 20 - 21, 2025, at the Barceló Marbella hotel in Marbella, Costa del Sol. The conference aims to gather professionals, academics, and students interested in research and practical applications of interaction design and human-computer interaction. It will cover various aspects including Human Factors and Information Systems, Interactive Devices, Interaction Design, and Adaptive and Intelligent Systems. CHIRA 2025 offers both in-person and remote (hybrid) participation options and is co-located with ICINCO 2025, WEBIST 2025, icSPORTS 2025, and CoopIS 2025. Accepted papers will be published by Springer in a CCIS Series book and submitted for evaluation for indexing in major international databases.
callForPapers:
# CHIRA 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA 2025) will take place on **October 20 - 21, 2025**, at the **Barceló Marbella hotel in Marbella, Costa del Sol**.

CHIRA aims to bring together professionals, academics, and students interested in the advancement of research and practical applications of interaction design and human-computer interaction. The conference will feature four parallel tracks, covering various aspects of Computer-Human Interaction.

### Participation Options

Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person), speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Keynote Lectures

*   Alice Chirico, Catholic University of Sacred Hearth, Italy

## Conference Areas (Topics)

### 1. Human Factors for Interactive Systems, Research, and Applications

*   User Preferences and Customization
*   Security and Privacy
*   User Behaviour Analysis
*   Modelling Human Factors
*   User Experience Evaluation
*   Decision Support Systems
*   Human-Centered AI
*   Collaborative Systems
*   Healthcare Applications
*   User Experience
*   Entertainment
*   Social Computing
*   Human-in-the-loop

### 2. Interactive Devices

*   Metaverse
*   Conversational Speech Interfaces
*   3D Interaction
*   Virtual, Augmented, Mixed, and Extended Reality
*   Wearable Sensors
*   Mobile Devices and Services
*   Human-Robot Interaction
*   Brain-Computer Interfaces
*   Gesture-Based Interaction
*   EEG Signal Processing

### 3. Interaction Design

*   User Experience Design
*   Accessible and Adaptive Interaction
*   Design and Evaluation
*   Interaction Design Modelling
*   Collaboration and Interaction Design
*   Mobile Computer-Human Interaction
*   User-Centered Interaction Design Patterns
*   Cognitive Interaction
*   Affective Computing
*   Multimedia and Multimodal Interaction

### 4. Adaptive and Intelligent Systems

*   Visualization Tools
*   Information Retrieval
*   Computational Interaction
*   Context-Aware Systems
*   Intelligent User Interfaces
*   Cognition, Communication and Interaction
*   Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Explainable AI (XAI)
*   Artificial Intelligence

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but are **not published** in the conference proceedings.

Complete papers can be submitted as:

*   **Regular Paper**: representing completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper**: portraying a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue discussing ideas, facts, situations, methods, procedures or results of scientific research focused on one of the conference topic areas.

### Submission Guidelines:

1.  **Language and Quality:** Papers must be submitted in English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling.
2.  **Content:** Each paper should clearly indicate the nature of its technical/scientific contribution, and the problems, domains or environments to which it is applicable.
3.  **Double-Blind Review:** To facilitate the double-blind paper evaluation method, authors are kindly requested to produce and provide the paper **WITHOUT any reference to any of the authors**, including personal details, acknowledgments section, and any other reference that may disclose the authors’ identity.
4.  **Originality and Plagiarism:** Only original papers should be submitted. Submissions must not substantially overlap work which has been published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted to a journal or another conference with proceedings. Papers that contain any form of plagiarism will be rejected without reviews. Authors should also avoid using an excessive number of self-citations.
5.  **Submission Platform:** All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS.
6.  **Formatting:** Submissions should follow the instructions and templates found under [Guidelines and Templates](https://chira.scitevents.org/Documents.aspx).

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published by **Springer in the conference proceedings**, under an ISBN reference.

The proceedings will be abstracted/indexed in:

*   DBLP
*   Google Scholar
*   EI-Compendex
*   INSPEC
*   Japanese Science and Technology Agency (JST)
*   Norwegian Register for Scientific Journals and Series
*   Mathematical Reviews
*   SCImago
*   Scopus
*   zbMATH

CCIS volumes are also submitted for inclusion in ISI Proceedings (Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index).

## Important Dates

All dates refer to **AOE (Anywhere on Earth)** time.

### Regular Papers

*   Paper Submission: **June 6, 2025** (expired)
*   Authors Notification: **July 17, 2025**
*   Camera Ready and Registration: **July 31, 2025**

### Position Papers / Regular Papers (Extended Deadline)

*   Paper Submission: **July 3, 2025** (extended)
*   Authors Notification: **July 31, 2025**
*   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 5, 2025**

### Abstracts Track

*   Abstract Submission: **July 31, 2025**
*   Authors Notification: **September 8, 2025**
*   Camera Ready and Registration: **September 17, 2025**

### Other Submissions

*   Workshop Proposal: **May 27, 2025** (expired)
*   Special Session Proposal: **May 27, 2025** (expired)
*   Tutorial Proposal: **September 11, 2025**
*   Demo Proposal: **September 11, 2025**
*   Panel Proposal: **September 11, 2025**

## Secretariat

*   **Address:** Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
*   **Tel.:** +351 265 520 184
*   **Fax:** +351 265 520 186
*   **e-mail:** [chira.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:chira.secretariat@insticc.org)
*   **Web:** [https://chira.scitevents.org](https://chira.scitevents.org)

## Conference Chairs

*   **Conference Chair:** Pietro Cipresso, Department of Psychology, University of Turin, Italy
*   **Program Co-Chairs:**
    *   Josef F. Krems, Chemnitz University of Technology, Cognitive and Engineering Psychology, Germany
    *   Hugo Plácido da Silva, IT- Instituto de Telecomunicações, Portugal

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - CHI PLAY 2025

## Overview

The Annual Symposium on Computer-Human Interaction in Play (CHI PLAY) is the premier international and interdisciplinary conference for researchers and professionals across all areas of play, games, and human-computer interaction (HCI), focusing on **player-computer interaction**. CHI PLAY 2025 will be held from **October 13-16, 2025, in Pittsburgh, USA**. The conference aims to highlight and foster discussion of high-quality research in games and HCI, blending academic research papers with interactive play demos, masterclasses, and industry insights.

All accepted submissions will be distributed in the CHI PLAY Conference Proceedings and will be available in the **ACM Digital Library**.

## Full Papers (GAMES Track)

The GAMES track of PACMHCI (CHI PLAY) welcomes research on player-computer interactions, including understanding player experience, contributions on novel designs or implementations, and theoretical advancements. The track also considers research on the effects of technologies, software, or algorithms on player experiences.

## Topics of Interest

We invite authors to submit their best research on all topics relevant to player-computer interactions and digital play. Submission should present original and mature research work. High-quality, elaborated case studies and practice reports with generalizable findings will also be considered. Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Novel input or output technologies for games and play
*   Studies that contribute to our understanding of player experience of digital play
*   Innovative game mechanics and playful interactions
*   Theoretical contributions on digital play and games
*   Accessible and inclusive design of player-computer interactions
*   Esports, live streaming, and spectator experiences
*   Advances in digital game user research, game evaluation methods, and methods for conducting games research
*   Psychology and typologies of digital games and players
*   Studies of applied, serious, and persuasive digital games (e.g., games and play for health, well-being, and learning)
*   Gamification and motivational design
*   Virtual and augmented reality in games and play
*   New tools for digital game creation and co-creation that directly affect player experience and/or player-computer interactions
*   Game analytics and novel visualizations of player-computer interactions
*   Developer experiences and studies of developers of digital games
*   Applications of human-centered game AI with implications for HCI games research
*   Critical and reflexive approaches to digital games & play design and experience
*   Gaming industry case studies

**Note:** Technical contributions without impact on players or other relevant people in the game community, or systems without a gameful or playful component, are generally out of scope.

## Other Submission Types

CHI PLAY also invites submissions for:

*   Companion Submission Overview & Guidelines
*   Work-in-Progress
*   Perspectives on Play
*   Student Game Design Competition
*   Interactivity
*   Connections
*   Doctoral Consortium
*   Video Guidelines and Technical Requirements

## Important Dates

(all times are 23:59 Anywhere on Earth or AoE)

1.  **Submission deadline:** February 19, 2025
2.  **Notifications given** (accept with minor revisions/revise and resubmit/reject): April 14, 2025
3.  **Revisions due:** June 2, 2025
4.  **Final notifications given:** July 4, 2025

## Submission Process Details

*   PACMHCI GAMES uses the **Precision Conference System (PCS) 2.0**: [https://new.precisionconference.com/submissions](https://new.precisionconference.com/submissions).
*   Select “SIGCHI” as the Society and “CHI PLAY” as the Conference/Journal to make a new submission.
*   **Authorship Policy:** Authors must comply with the ACM Policy on Authorship, including originality, proper attribution, and no concurrent submissions. Author lists cannot be changed after the submission deadline.
*   **Confidentiality:** Submitted material confidentiality will be maintained.
*   **ORCID ID:** Authors are strongly encouraged to obtain an ORCID ID for the publishing process.

## Formatting and Length

*   PACMHCI GAMES uses the **ACM Journals Primary Article Template**, available for LaTeX (and Overleaf) and Word: [https://dl.acm.org/journal/pacmhci/submission-templates](https://dl.acm.org/journal/pacmhci/submission-templates).
*   No minimum or maximum page length is imposed; reviewers weigh contribution relative to length. Typical papers are under 10,000 words (approx. 17-20 pages single-column), excluding references and appendices.

## Anonymous Review Policy

*   Submissions must have authors’ names and affiliations removed, and avoid obvious identifying statements.
*   Grant information that identifies authors/institutions should be removed.
*   Citations to authors' own relevant work should be anonymized (e.g., "Prior work by [authors]").
*   Papers that violate the anonymization policy will be desk rejected.

## Revision Cycles and Decisions

*   **Accept with Minor Revisions:** Requires minor changes; final version due by revision deadline.
*   **Revise and Resubmit:** Requires major changes; revised manuscript due by revision deadline for re-review. Not all resubmissions are guaranteed acceptance.
*   **Reject:** Not acceptable in current form or unable to complete revisions.
*   **Desk Reject:** For submissions that are incomplete, non-anonymized, concurrent, out of scope, improperly formatted, or of low quality/substance.

## Contribution Type for Review Handling

Authors can indicate primary and secondary contribution types for reviewer assignment (e.g., Empirical-Qualitative, Artefact-Technical, Theoretical).

## Open and Transparent Science

Authors are encouraged to submit supplementary material (e.g., interview guides, videos, pre-registrations on OSF) and use open access repositories. Supplementary materials must be anonymized.

## ACM Policy on Use of Generative AI

Generative AI use is permitted but must be disclosed, and authors are responsible for the content and plagiarism. AI tools cannot be listed as authors.

## ACM Publications Policy on Research Involving Human Participants

Authors must adhere to ethical and legal standards for research involving human participants, including informed consent and minimization of harm. A description of participant handling will be required.

## Video Figures

*   **Mandatory** for submissions involving custom-built games or systems not freely available.
*   Showcase core mechanics or provide a playthrough.
*   Max three minutes long.
*   Submissions lacking this may be desk rejected if the system cannot be assessed.

## Presenting at the CHI PLAY Conference

Accepted papers will be invited to present at the ACM CHI PLAY conference in Fall 2025. Presentation is strongly recommended but not required for publication in PACM HCI.

## More Information

For more information, visit [https://chiplay.acm.org/2025/](https://chiplay.acm.org/2025/).

callForPapers:
# CERIAS Cybersecurity Symposium 2025: Call for Participation

The 26th Annual CERIAS Cybersecurity Symposium, themed **"Cyber Horizons: Bridging Academia, Industry, and Innovation for a Secure Future"**, will be held from **Tuesday, April 1 – Wednesday, April 2, 2025**, at the **Purdue Memorial Union, Second floor, 101 S. Grant St., West Lafayette, IN**.

This premier gathering of thought leaders, innovators, and practitioners is dedicated to shaping the future of cybersecurity. The event will explore the dynamic interplay between academia and industry, discuss lessons learned from the cyber battle space, and learn about the revolutionary framework for building the future of secure cyber-physical systems. It will also examine AI as a tool for advancing the field and spotlight innovations that define the cutting edge of security solutions.

## Key Dates

*   **Symposium Dates:** April 1 – April 2, 2025
*   **Online Registration:** Closed

## Agenda and Speakers

*   [Agenda](https://events.research.purdue.edu/cerias/agenda)
*   [Speakers](https://events.research.purdue.edu/cerias/speakers/)

## Poster Session

A poster session will be held at 6:30 PM in the PMU North Ballroom.

*   [2025 Poster List](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/symposium/index.php/posters/year/2025)
*   [Information for Poster Presenters](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/site/symposium2025/presenters/)
*   [Poster Templates](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/site/poster/templates)

## Symposium Archive

*   [2024](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/site/symposium2024/)
*   [2023](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/site/symposium2023/)
*   [2022](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/site/symposium2022/)
*   [More…](https://www.cerias.purdue.edu/site/symposium/#archive)

## Continuing Professional Education (CPE)

callForPapers:
# CIDR 2025: Call for Papers

The Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR) is a systems-oriented conference, complementary to mainstream database conferences, emphasizing the systems architecture perspective. CIDR 2025 will be held in **Amsterdam, The Netherlands, from January 19-22, 2025**.

## Overview

CIDR gathers researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to discuss innovative and visionary ideas in data management systems. It encourages contributions on novel approaches to data management systems, architecture, and usage, including cloud-based systems, data storage, networking, hardware acceleration, custom processors, memory hierarchies, processor interconnects, and ML/AI technologies for data processing. CIDR values innovation, experience-based insight, and vision.

## Contribution Types

CIDR 2025 invites two kinds of contributions:

*   **Papers:** (at most 6 pages) Including regular research papers and more visionary papers that promote interesting ideas and ongoing work.
*   **Demos:** (at most 6 pages) This can be a video or a description of the demo.

To encourage authors to submit only their best work, each person can be an author or co-author of **at most one submission** of any kind.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** Papers should be submitted in PDF format.
*   **Length:** Papers must not exceed 6 pages, including all references and appendix.
*   **Template:** Submissions must be formatted using the double-column ACM sigconf style. LaTeX and Word templates are available.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submit electronically via CMT: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2025)
*   **Presentation:** At least one author of an accepted paper or demo is expected to attend the conference in person to present.

## Important Dates

(All deadlines are 11:59pm Pacific Time)

*   **Submission deadline:** August 2nd, 2024
*   **Author notification:** October 4th, 2024
*   **Conference Dates:** January 19-22, 2025

## Camera-Ready Guidelines

*   Follow the formatting instructions above.
*   Include the following copyright notice at the bottom left of the first page:
    > This paper is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY 4.0) license. Authors reserve their rights to disseminate the work on their personal and corporate Web sites with the appropriate attribution, provided that you attribute the original work to the authors and CIDR 2025. 15th Annual Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR '25). January 19-22, 2025, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
*   Recommended LaTeX style file and Word template files include the copyright notice.

## Diversity and Inclusion

Authors are strongly urged to follow the D&I writing instructions when drafting paper submissions.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers (General Information for CICLing)

The International Conference on Intelligent Text Processing and Computational Linguistics (CICLing) is a series of conferences devoted to computational linguistics (CL), intelligent text processing, natural language processing (NLP), human language technologies (HLT), natural-language human-computer interaction (HCI), and speech processing and speech recognition (SR).

## Scope and Topics of Interest

CICLing covers a broad range of topics including, but not limited to:

*   Text processing
*   Computational morphology, tagging, stemming
*   Syntactic analysis, parsing, shallow parsing, chunking
*   Recognizing textual entailment
*   Ambiguity resolution
*   Semantic analysis, pragmatics
*   Lexicon, lexical resources, dictionaries, machine-readable dictionaries (MRD)
*   Grammar, anaphora resolution
*   Word sense disambiguation (WSD)
*   Machine translation (MT)
*   Information retrieval (IR), information extraction (IE)
*   Document handling, document classification, text classification
*   Text summarization, text mining (TM)
*   Spell checking

## Submission Information

*Please note: The provided text primarily focuses on past events and general information about CICLing. Specific deadlines, submission guidelines, and contribution types for a future conference (e.g., CICLing 2025) are not explicitly detailed in this content.* 

Past publications are available in Springer LNCS volumes and indexed in ISI Web of Science, Scopus/SJR, DBLP/Libra, EI Compendex, and Zentralblatt Math.

Authors are encouraged to consult the official CICLing website for the most current Call for Papers and submission details for upcoming conferences.

# CIBCB 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 IEEE Symposium on Computational Intelligence in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology (CIBCB) is scheduled to take place from **August 20-22, 2025**, at the **National Cheng Kung University in Tainan, Taiwan**. The conference's central theme is **"AI Drives Biomedical, Bioinformatics and Healthcare"**.

We invite researchers and practitioners to submit their work related to computational intelligence in bioinformatics and computational biology.

Further details regarding the call for papers, special sessions, tutorials, and submission guidelines are available through the following resources:

callForPapers:
# Call for Full Research Papers

The Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM) provides a unique venue for industry and academia to present and discuss state-of-the-art research on artificial intelligence, search and discovery, data mining, and database systems. CIKM 2025 will take place between **November 10-14, 2025** in **Coex, Seoul, Korea**.

## Topics of Interest

We encourage submissions of high-quality research papers on the general areas of artificial intelligence, data science, databases, information retrieval, and knowledge management. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following areas:

*   Data acquisition and processing (e.g., IoT Data, Data Quality, Data Privacy, Mitigating Biases, Data Wrangling, Data exploration, Data Preparation, Valuation, and Trading)
*   Data Integration and aggregation (e.g., Semantic Processing, data provenance, data linkage, data fusion, knowledge graph, data warehousing, data lake, privacy and security, modeling, information credibility)
*   Efficient data processing (e.g., serverless, data-intensive computing, database systems, indexing and compression, architectures, distributed data systems, dataspaces, customized hardware)
*   Special data processing (e.g., multilingual text, sequential, stream, time series, spatio-temporal, (knowledge) graph, multimedia, scientific, and social media data)
*   Analytics and machine learning (e.g., OLAP, data mining, machine learning and AI, scalable analysis algorithms, algorithmic biases, event detection and tracking, algorithmic interpretability)
*   Neural Information and knowledge processing (e.g., graph neural networks, domain adaptation, transfer learning, network architectures, neural ranking, neural recommendation, and neural prediction)
*   Information access and retrieval (e.g., Information Retrieval with Large Language Models, Question Answering and Dialogue Systems, Open-ended Question Answering Systems, Generation of Knowledge Graphs from Unstructured data, Retrieval Models, Query Processing, Personalization, Recommender Systems, Filtering Systems)
*   Users and interfaces for information systems (e.g., user behavior analysis, user interface design, perception of biases, interactive information retrieval, interactive analysis, spoken interfaces)
*   Evaluation (e.g., performance studies, benchmarks, online and offline evaluation, best practices)
*   Crowdsourcing (e.g. task assignment, worker reliability, optimization, trustworthiness, transparency, crowdsourcing in the era of large language models)
*   Mining multi-modal content (e.g., natural language processing, speech recognition, computer vision, content understanding, knowledge extraction, knowledge representations)
*   Data presentation (e.g., visualization, summarization, readability, VR, speech input/output)
*   Fairness, Ethics, and Explainability in Information and Knowledge Management (e.g., fairness, accountability, ethics, explainability)
*   Applications (e.g., urban systems, biomedical and health informatics, legal informatics, crisis informatics, computational social science, data-enabled discovery, social networks, education, business)
*   Generative AI for Data and Knowledge Management (e.g., GenAI for structured and unstructured data processing, GenAI for data synthesis and simulation, GenAI for information summarization, content creation, and visualization)
*   Resource Efficient Generative AI models for knowledge management (e.g., model compression, distributed learning, and leveraging edge computing to reduce computational overhead.)

## Key Dates

All deadlines are at 11:59pm in the Anywhere on Earth (AoE) time zone.

*   **Full Research Papers Abstract Deadline:** May 16, 2025
*   **Applied Research Papers Abstract Deadline:** May 16, 2025
*   **Full Research Papers Submission Deadline:** May 23, 2025
*   **Applied Research Papers Submission Deadline:** May 23, 2025
*   **Short Research Papers Abstract Deadline:** May 30, 2025
*   **Short Research Papers Submission Deadline:** June 6, 2025
*   **Resource Papers Abstract Deadline:** June 10, 2025
*   **Demo Papers Abstract Deadline:** June 10, 2025
*   **Resource Papers Submission Deadline:** June 17, 2025
*   **Demo Papers Submission Deadline:** June 17, 2025
*   **Notification (for Full, Short, Applied, Resource, and Demo Papers):** August 4, 2025

## Workshops & Tutorials

*   **Tutorials Proposal Submission:** June 14, 2025
*   **Workshops Proposal Submission:** June 28, 2025
*   **Tutorials Proposal Notification:** July 8, 2025
*   **Workshops Proposal Notification:** July 19, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Contribution Types:** Full Research Papers, Short Research Papers, Applied Research Papers, Resource Papers, Demo Papers, Workshops, Tutorials, AnalytiCup Competition Proposals, PhD Symposium, Industry Day Talks.
*   **Paper Format:** Manuscripts should be submitted in PDF format, using the 2-column ACM sigconf template. See: [https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template](https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template).
*   **Page Limits:** Full papers cannot exceed 9 pages, including an appendix, plus unlimited pages for the GenAI Usage Disclosure section and references.
*   **Review Process:** The review of manuscripts will be double-blind. Submissions not properly anonymized will be desk-rejected.
*   **Generative AI Usage:** Papers that include text generated from a large-scale language model (LLM) are prohibited unless this produced text is presented as part of the paper’s experimental analysis. AI tools may be used for light editing (e.g., grammar checks, word autocorrect), but text produced entirely by generative AI models is not allowed.
*   **GenAI Usage Disclosure:** A “GenAI Usage Disclosure” section is required at the end of the main content and appendix, right before the references. Authors must disclose all use of GenAI tools. This section, along with references, will not count towards the page limit.
*   **Dual Submission Policy:** Submitting identical or substantially similar versions of papers to other conferences or venues is not allowed. Abstract submissions are allowed if the full paper review concludes by the final deadline. Preprints (e.g., arXiv) are allowed if anonymized.
*   **Authorship Policy:** The full list of author names and ordering must be finalized by the paper submission deadline.
*   **Plagiarism:** Submissions will be checked for plagiarism.
*   **Conflict of Interest:** All authors must adhere to the ACM Conflict of Interest policy.
*   **Desk Rejection Policy:** Submissions violating anonymity, length, formatting, or ACM policies (plagiarism, author misrepresentation) may be desk-rejected.
*   **Harassment Policy:** All authors and participants must adhere to the ACM Policy Against Harassment.
*   **Attendance Policy:** At least one author of each accepted paper must register and present on-site in Seoul, Korea.

## Submission Links

*   [Click here to submit your Full Research Paper](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cikm25)

## PC Chairs Contact Information

For more information, contact the PC chairs at [cikm2025-pc@easychair.org](mailto:cikm2025-pc@easychair.org):

*   Carl Yang, Emory University, USA
*   Senjuti Basu Roy, New Jersey Institute of Technology, USA
*   Jessie Li, Yunqi Academy of Engineering, China
*   Jaap Kamps, University of Amsterdam, Netherlands

callForPapers:
# IEEE Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Data Mining (CIDM) 2025 - Call for Papers

IEEE SSCI is widely recognized for cultivating the interchange of state-of-the-art theories and sophisticated algorithms within the broad realm of Computational Intelligence Applications. The Symposia provide for cross-pollination of research concepts, fostering an environment that facilitates future inter and intra collaborations.

The 2025 event marks a significant milestone in the evolution of IEEE SSCI, launching the newly restructured biennial Symposia Series featuring ten dedicated Applied Computational Intelligence Symposia:

*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI for Energy, Transport and Environmental Sustainability (IEEE CIETES)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI in Engineering / Cyber Physical Systems (IEEE CIES)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI in Image, Signal Processing and Synthetic Media (IEEE CISM)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI in Artificial Life and Cooperative Intelligent Systems (IEEE ALIFE-CIS)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI in Security, Defence and Biometrics (IEEE CISDB)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI in Health and Medicine (IEEE CIHM)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI for Financial Engineering and Economics (IEEE CiFer)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on CI in Natural Language Processing and Social Media (IEEE CI-NLPSoMe)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia on Trustworthy, Explainable and Responsible CI (IEEE CITreX)
*   2025 IEEE Symposia for Multidisciplinary Computational Intelligence Incubators (IEEE MCII)

## Venue

IEEE SSCI 2025 is hosted in **Trondheim, Norway**, offering a stunning winter location with opportunities for skiing, experiencing longer days, milder weather, and potentially seeing the Northern Lights. The downtown area is easily walkable to attractions, shopping, and restaurants.

## Late Submission Opportunities

IEEE SSCI 2025 offers several submission options for late-breaking research:

*   **Late-Breaking Papers:** Submit an extended abstract of up to 2 pages to share preliminary research, ideas, or critiques, fostering interactive discussions.
*   **Poster-Only Submissions:** Submit a short abstract (up to 250 words) to present early-stage concepts or challenges for constructive feedback.
*   **Journal to Conference (J2C) Submissions:** Provide a summary (up to 1 page) of recent journal articles relevant to SSCI themes, promoting broader engagement with your research.

For more instructions on each kind of submission, including page limitations and submission format, please see [submission instructions](?ui=submission-instructions).

## Paper Formats

| Type of Paper              | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | Length                                                 | Publication Format                                                                | Presentation Format         |
| :------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :-------------------------- |
| Full papers                | Complete papers describing your novel research in full.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Up to 6 pages, plus 1 page for references. Max 2 extra pages allowed (up to 8 pages + 1 ref page) at an additional charge. | To be submitted for publication in the respective symposium proceedings | Lightning talk + poster     |
| Short papers               | Papers with novel insights, approaches, or ideas which may not have been fully tested yet.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Up to 4 pages, plus 1 page for references.             | To be submitted for publication in the respective symposium proceedings | Poster                      |
| Late breaking papers       | Extended abstracts with a "prequel" to provoke novel conversations for future work or ideas to emerge, or with a "sequel" to a prior research contribution, or with a discussion to alert the community of important topics that may not yet have received sufficient attention, or with an original discussion or critique of existing methodologies. | Up to 2 pages, including references, if any.           | For presentation at the conference but not to be included in the proceedings.       | Poster                      |
| Abstract (poster-only) submission | Abstracts may involve, e.g., novel insights, or new ideas which may not have been fully tested yet, or presentation of challenges posed by a given domain that could benefit from computational intelligence.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | Up to 250 words.                                       | For presentation at the conference but not to be included in the proceedings.       | Poster                      |
| Journal to conference (J2C) | Papers accepted at IEEE Transactions journals sponsored by CIS and first appeared in IEEEXplore within the past 2 years.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | Up to 1 page listing bullet points with the highlights of the paper, and an explanation on why you believe the paper to be relevant to SSCI. | For presentation at the conference but not to be included in the conference proceedings. | Lightning talk + poster     |

summary: The 22nd Cooperative Design, Visualization, and Engineering (CDVE) conference will be held in Bangkok, Thailand, from October 19-22, 2025, hosted by the School of Information Technology, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology. The conference focuses on "cooperative" concepts across design, visualization, and engineering, inviting participation from researchers worldwide. Keynote speaker will be Prof. Jaime Lloret, discussing "Intelligent collaborative sensor networks for Precision Agriculture." Accepted papers will be published in Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS).
callForPapers:
# CDVE 2025: Call for Papers

The Cooperative Design, Visualization, and Engineering (CDVE) conference series, now in its 22nd year, invites submissions of original papers focusing on the "cooperative" concept. The conference will be held in **Bangkok, Thailand, from October 19-22, 2025**.

## Conference Focus

The conference scope encompasses multiple users, multiple locations, multiple units, and multiple sensors, with a strong emphasis on cooperative aspects.

## Major Areas and Topics

### Cooperative Design (CD)

*   Multiple user, multiple location collaborative design applications
*   Concurrent design, collaborative editing, real-time user interactions
*   Cooperative User Experience (UX) design
*   Demonstrating feasibility and applicability in CD
*   Multi-modal interface design (e.g., cooperative design using interactive tabletops and surfaces)
*   Design for total life cycle support: from design to manufacturing or construction
*   Cooperative design analysis, verification, integration, and interoperability, standards
*   Scenarios, case studies of cooperative design in mechanical engineering, aero-space engineering, building architecture, engineering and construction, automobile, microelectronics, software engineering, entertainment, and other areas
*   Special issues in cooperative design

### Cooperative Visualization (CV)

*   System architecture, prototypes, user interfaces for CV: web applications, textual and multimedia 2D, 3D desktop interfaces, 3D virtual world environments, and multiple user embedded systems.
*   Visualization for multiple users, multiple locations, concurrent visualization
*   Cooperative visual analytics and communication
*   Large scale, big data storage, access, exploration, and manipulation for cooperative visualization
*   Multi-resolution and other efficient computer graphics, visualization algorithms for cooperative visualization
*   Visualization in multiple user games, networked games, simulation visualization for multiple users

### Cooperative Engineering (CE)

*   Collaborative process planning, scheduling, control, conformance testing and interoperability checking, cooperative decision making.
*   Human-machine interfaces, frameworks, reference models, architectures, tools, and systems for CE
*   Concurrent prototyping, manufacturing, and engineering.
*   Concurrent process modeling, product modeling, reference models, business models, data representations, and standards.
*   Integration and interoperability, intelligent infrastructures, and automated methods for integrating systems, multi-level integration, enterprise integration
*   Long-term large scale project data archiving, access, concurrent data control for CE
*   Smart grids
*   Industrial scenarios, case studies of CE: in mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, AEC (architecture, engineering and construction), automobile, microelectronics, and others
*   Methods, applications for total life cycle support: from conceptual design to manufacturing and construction

### Cooperative Applications (CA)

*   Human computer interface for cooperative working
*   Cooperation between humans and autonomous systems
*   Social networks
*   Crowd sourcing
*   Collective intelligence
*   Cooperative learning, multi-modal learning
*   Multiple user gaming
*   Multiple platform payment systems
*   Multimodal user interface for cooperation
*   Cooperative decision making
*   Cooperative Internet of Things (IoT)
*   Nano networks, nano-communication, nano sensors
*   Collaborative Information seeking
*   Information integration in sensor networks
*   Collaborations in emergency response and disaster management
*   Collaborative mobile systems, group interaction in mobile systems and mobility communities
*   Collaborative simulation
*   Collaborative robots and human-robot interaction, social robots
*   Collaboration technologies and systems for healthcare
*   Web-based cooperation tools, cooperative web design (e.g., Wikis)
*   Cooperative service-oriented applications
*   Other cooperative applications

### Basic Theories, Methods, and Technologies that support CDVE (BT)

*   Modeling of group behavior
*   Distributed systems, grid systems, real-time systems, groupware
*   Cooperation issues in metaverse, digital twins
*   Cloud computing, edge computing for cooperative work
*   Fog computing for cooperative storage, cooperative working
*   Big data processing, fusion
*   Multi-sensor data processing, fusion
*   Neural networks for CDVE
*   Blockchains, distributed ledger technology
*   Algorithms, architectures, frameworks, platforms for CDVE
*   Data consistency, concurrent processing, middleware
*   Agent-based methods, conversational agents, hybrid conversational agents combining human and machine intelligence (cooperative CAs)
*   Collaborative and multi-mode working environments
*   Design patterns, re-usability, and component-based methods
*   Communication, transport, application protocols for CDVE
*   Internet computing, web environment for collaborative working
*   Knowledge management, information systems, large databases, data-mining
*   Semantic Technologies for Information-Integrated Collaboration
*   Ontology for information sharing, cooperative applications
*   Security for CDVE
*   Human machine interaction for CDVE
*   Artificial intelligence for CDVE

## Special Issue Opportunity

CDVE2025 Special Issue on IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Magazine: "Advance in cooperative design, visualization, engineering, and other cooperative applications." The best quality papers from CDVE2025 will be selected for publication. To be considered, authors must submit a paper to CDVE2025 first.

## Deadlines

*   **Submission:** (Extended by 2 weeks for the special issue call)
*   **Notification:** (Not specified in Call for Papers section, but typically follows submission)
*   **Registration:** Begins now (Early registration welcome for accepted papers or general participation).

## Submission Process

*   All submissions should be made through the EasyChair system: **cdve2025@easychair.org**.
*   Papers should be original and not under review elsewhere.

## Publication

All accepted full papers and short papers with valid registration will be published in the **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series by Springer.

Each paper will have an independent DOI and will be indexed in major systems including:

*   Conference Proceedings Citation Index (CPCI)
*   Zentralblatt MATH
*   EI Engineering Index (Compendex and Inspec databases)
*   Scopus
*   ACM Digital Library
*   IO-Port
*   dblp
*   MathSciNet
*   Google Scholar

## Organizers

*   School of Information Technology, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology
*   University of Balearic Islands
*   Luxembourg Institute of Science and Technology

## Technical Sponsor

*   Visual Analytics and Communication Technical Committee (IEEE SMC)

## Supporting Organizations

*   Information Visualization Society
*   Interaction Design Foundation

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CISIS 2025

The 18th International Conference on Computational Intelligence in Security for Information Systems (CISIS 2025) aims to offer a meeting opportunity for academic and industry-related researchers from the fields of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining. The conference is intended to catalyze and aggregate efforts towards intelligent, flexible systems, particularly in mission-critical domains.

CISIS 2025 is part of the **International Joint Conferences HAIS-SOCO-CISIS-ICEUTE & STARTUP OLÉ** and will be held on **16-17 October 2025** in **Salamanca, Spain**.

## Topics of Interest

*   Computational Intelligence
*   Information Security
*   Cybersecurity
*   Data Mining

For a detailed list of topics, please visit: [http://cisisconference.eu/topics/](http://cisisconference.eu/topics/)

## Submission Types and Guidelines

*   **Paper Length:** Papers must be prepared according to the **LNNS style template** and must be no more than **ten (10) pages** long, including figures and bibliography. Additional pages (over 10 pages) will be charged **150 euros** for each page.
*   **Presentation:** All accepted papers must be presented by one of the authors, who must register for the conference and pay the fee.
*   **Format:** Templates are available at [http://sococonference.eu/paper-submission-publication](http://sococonference.eu/paper-submission-publication).

## Publication

*   CISIS’25 proceedings will be published by **Springer** in a special volume of **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (LNNS)**.
*   Indexed by **SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago**.

## Special Issues

All accepted papers (submitted to general track and special sessions) will be considered for possible inclusion in a special issue of **Neurocomputing (ELSEVIER)** (2024 JCR Impact Factor: 5.5 – Q1).

## Call for Special Sessions

Researchers are invited to submit proposals for organizing Special Sessions. Proposals are due by **15th March 2025**.

**Conditions for Organizers:**

*   Select a topic of interest to conference delegates.
*   Obtain a minimum of 5 papers for the session, with at least 60% by authors not affiliated with the session chairs or reviewers.
*   Manage the review process for session papers according to deadlines.
*   Provide suitable reviewers.
*   Ensure final paper versions are uploaded before the deadline.
*   Attend the conference and chair the session.
*   Disseminate the call for papers for the special session.

**Proposal Requirements:**

*   Title of the special session and selected conference (SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25).
*   Name of chair/co-chairs, email/s, and affiliation/s.
*   One or two paragraphs describing the session content.
*   List of at least 10 international reviewers (including chairs) from at least three different universities (name, family name, email, affiliation).
*   Description of the plan to disseminate the special session (CFPs, etc.).

Submit proposals via email to [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es).

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** 15th March 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** 1st June 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** 15th June 2025
*   **Submission of revised papers:** 30th June 2025
*   **Final version submission:** 5th July 2025
*   **Payment deadline:** 10th July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 16th–17th October 2025

## Submission System

Submissions should be made through the following EasyChair links:

*   **CISIS’25:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025)

## Committees

**General Chair:**
*   Dr. Emilio Corchado (University of Salamanca, Spain)

**Co-Chairs:**
*   Dr. Alicia Troncoso Lora (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Hilde Pérez García (University of León, Spain)
*   Dr. Esteban Jove (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. José Luis Calvo Rolle (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Javier Martínez de Pisón (University of La Rioja, Spain)
*   Dr. Pablo García Bringas (University of Deusto, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Martínez Álvarez (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Alvaro Herrero Cosio (University of Burgos, Spain)
*   Dr. Paolo Fosci (University of Bergamo, Italy)
*   Dr. Héctor Quintián (University of A Coruña, Spain)

## Contact

For conference-related issues or doubts, please contact: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es)

callForPapers:
# The 19th International Conference on Complex, Intelligent, and Software Intensive Systems (CISIS-2025)

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** July 2, 2025 – July 4, 2025
*   **Location:** Fukuoka Institute of Technology (FIT), Fukuoka, Japan
*   **In conjunction with:** IMIS-2025 ([https://voyager.ce.fit.ac.jp/conf/imis/2025/](https://voyager.ce.fit.ac.jp/conf/imis/2025/))
*   **Paper Submission Link:** [https://edas.info/N32802](https://edas.info/N32802)
*   **Call for Papers Download:** [./public/CISIS-2025-CFPs-V5.pdf](./public/CISIS-2025-CFPs-V5.pdf)

## Aim & Scope

The aim of the conference is to deliver a platform of scientific interaction between three interwoven challenging areas of research and development of future ICT-enabled applications: Software Intensive Systems, Complex Systems, and Intelligent Systems. CISIS-2025 aims to provide a forum for in-depth scientific discussions amongst these communities, leading to significant contributions.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Monitoring and Control of Large Systems or Environments
*   Managing the Heterogeneity of Knowledge by Means of Ontologies
*   Service Oriented Architectures for Complex Applications in Business and Industries
*   Consideration of Software Intensive Systems as Complex Systems
*   Knowledge Management of Complex IT-systems
*   Pervasive, Ubiquitous, Ad Hoc and Mobile Systems
*   Fog Computing
*   Heterogeneous Networking
*   Socially Inspired Complex Systems
*   Blockchain computing
*   Complex Systems and Dependability
*   Usability of Complex Systems
*   Database and Data Mining Applications
*   Artificial Intelligence and Bio-Inspired Computing
*   Multimedia Systems and Virtual Reality
*   Next Generation Wireless Networks
*   Semantic Web and Web Services
*   Security and Trusted Computing
*   HPC and Cloud Computing Services
*   Parallel, Distributed and Multicore Computing
*   Multi-agent Systems and Social Computing
*   Internet of Everything and Machine Learning

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** April 7, 2025 (Hard Deadline)
*   **Authors Notification:** April 10, 2025
*   **Author Registration:** April 25, 2025
*   **Final Manuscript:** April 25, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 2 - July 4, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Papers must be a maximum of **12 pages** in length, including all figures, tables, and references.
*   Authors can add up to **2 extra pages** with the appropriate fee payment.
*   Papers must be prepared using the **Lecture Notes Style of Springer Proceedings**.
*   Papers must be formatted in **PDF** format.
*   Submit electronically via the CISIS-2025 Web page.

## Publication

*   All accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings of **Lecture Notes in Data Engineering and Communication Technologies (LNDECT) series published by Springer**.
*   The LNDECT series are indexed by EI and SCOPUS.
*   Authors of accepted papers will be invited to submit extended versions to Special Issues.

## Workshops

*   Workshop proposals should be submitted to the CISIS-2025 International Conference Organizers by **February 15, 2025**.
*   Proceedings of CISIS-2025 workshops will be published together with CISIS-2025 by Springer.

# CLEI 2025: Call for Papers

The 51st Latin American Conference on Informatics (CLEI) invites papers reporting results of a theoretical and/or practical nature that advance the state of the art or present relevant applications or cases in the areas of interest of the symposia and associated events.

CLEI LI will take place in **Valparaiso, Chile**.

## Tracks

*   Software Systems
*   Intelligent Systems
*   Systems in Practice
*   Information Technology
*   Computer Education

## Associated Events

*   LAWCC – XVII Latin American Women in Computing Congress
*   CLTM – XXXII Latin American Master’s Thesis Competition
*   CLTD – XI Latin American Doctoral Thesis Competition
*   ELI – IV Latin American School of Informatics
*   TLISC – II Latin American Workshop on Quantum Engineering and Software
*   LADC – Latin American Symposium on Trustworthy and Secure Computing
*   Chilean Computer Science Conference 2025
*   IEEE CHILECON2025 – 2025 IEEE Chilean Conference on Electrical, Electronic Engineering, Informatics and Communications Technology

## Contact

clei2025@pucv.cl

## General Information

The Latin American Conference on Informatics (CLEI) is an annual event organized by the Latin American Center for Informatics Studies, held since 1974. It is the most important Latin American space for the exchange of ideas, experiences, and research results among researchers, professionals, teachers, and students of Computer Science and Informatics, as well as their technological applications.

Its objective is the exchange of ideas, experiences, and research results in areas of interest to the community, through conferences, workshops, tutorials, and panels.

*Note: Specific submission deadlines and formatting guidelines are not provided in the main content. Please refer to the "Call for Papers" PDF for detailed information.*

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The International Conference on Cloud Computing and Services Science (CLOSER) is a premier event focused on the critical area of Cloud Computing and its integral link to Services Science. CLOSER explores how Cloud Computing is transforming IT through externalized systems, on-demand delivery, and various 'as a service' models, fostering creativity and competitive advantage.

## SCOPE

The conference delves into Cloud Computing where Services Science provides the theoretical framework, methods, and techniques for designing, analyzing, managing, marketing, and studying various aspects of Cloud Computing. It addresses the impact of emerging enterprise technologies on IT economics, efficiency, processes, and usage models.

## CONFERENCE AREAS

1.  **CLOUD COMPUTING ENABLING TECHNOLOGY**
    *   API Management
    *   Virtualization Technologies
    *   Containers, Containerization and Enablement
    *   Container Composition and Orchestration
    *   Container Performance
    *   Microservices
    *   Multi-Cloud Solutions Enablement
    *   Cloud Quality and Performance
    *   Cloud Optimization and Automation
    *   Cloud Management and Operations
    *   High Performance Cloud Computing
    *   Cloud Migration
    *   Monitoring of Services, Quality of Service, Service Level Agreements
    *   Function-as-a-Service and Serverless Computing

2.  **CLOUD COMPUTING FUNDAMENTALS**
    *   Cloud Application Portability
    *   Federated Cloud
    *   Cloud Computing Architecture
    *   Cloud Delivery Models
    *   Cloud Deployment Models: Public/Private/Hybrid Cloud
    *   Cloud Interoperability
    *   Cloud Risk, Challenges and Governance
    *   Cloud Standards
    *   QoS for Applications on Clouds
    *   Resource Management
    *   Energy Efficient Cloud Computing

3.  **CLOUD COMPUTING PLATFORMS AND APPLICATIONS**
    *   Development Methods for Cloud Applications
    *   XaaS
    *   Cloud Services
    *   Cloud Data Centers, Storage and Networking Technologies
    *   Cloud Workflow Management Systems
    *   Cloud Solution Design Patterns
    *   Native Cloud Applications
    *   Cloud Application Architectures
    *   Cloud Application Scalability and Availability
    *   Cloud Applications Performance and Monitoring
    *   Cloud Middleware Frameworks
    *   Digital Twinning
    *   Blockchains
    *   Metaverse, Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality
    *   Web 3.0 / Spatial Web
    *   Mobile Cloud Architectures and Models
    *   Mobile Cloud Networking
    *   Cloud Cost Analysis

4.  **EDGE CLOUD AND FOG COMPUTING**
    *   Edge Cloud Orchestration
    *   Cluster Management
    *   Edge Cloud Network Management
    *   Edge Cloud Data Management
    *   IoT-Cloud Integration
    *   AI-enabled Edge Cloud
    *   Multi-access Edge Cloud
    *   Cloud Continuum

5.  **SERVICES**
    *   Service Modeling and Specification
    *   Service Monitoring and Control
    *   Service Ecosystems
    *   Service Simulation
    *   Service Performance Analytics
    *   Analytics and Services
    *   Business Process Management and Web Services
    *   Service Innovation
    *   Service Lifecycle Management
    *   Service-Oriented Architecture
    *   Service Management
    *   Service Platforms
    *   Enterprise Architectures and Services
    *   Industrial Applications of Services Science
    *   Internet of Services
    *   Microservices: Automation, Deployment and Management, Resource Allocation Elasticity, Service State and Resilience

6.  **CLOUD SECURITY AND PRIVACY**
    *   Container Security and Isolation
    *   Security, Privacy and Compliance Management
    *   Privacy, Security and Trust
    *   Access Control
    *   Services Security and Reliability
    *   (Multi Factor) Authorization
    *   Privacy and Privacy Assurance
    *   (Decentralized) Trust
    *   Intrusion Detection

## KEYNOTE SPEAKERS

*   Aaron Ding, TU Delft, Netherlands
*   Sonia Ben Mokhtar, LIRIS CNRS, France
*   Philipp Leitner, Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden

## PAPER SUBMISSION

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** (for publication in proceedings) or an **abstract** (presented but not published). Accepted complete papers can be submitted as:

*   **Regular Paper:** For completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper:** For works in progress or arguable opinions.

Authors must submit papers in English, ensuring correct grammar and spelling. Submissions should address conference areas and clearly state the contribution and applicability.

**Double-blind paper evaluation** is used: authors must exclude any personal details, acknowledgments, or references that could identify them.

Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism. Substantially overlapping work or simultaneous submissions will be rejected.

Submissions must be made through the **PRIMORIS online submission platform**. Please follow the instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates. Authors will receive an automatic confirmation e-mail upon successful submission.

## PUBLICATIONS

All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings with an ISBN reference, in both paper and digital formats.

*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and each paper will receive a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).
*   Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   Revised and extended versions of presented papers will be published with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).

## IMPORTANT DATES

*   **Conference Date:** April 1-3, 2025
*   **Regular Papers Submission:** November 18, 2024
*   **Authors Notification (Regular Papers):** January 6, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration (Regular Papers):** January 23, 2025
*   **Position Papers /Regular Papers Submission:** January 3, 2025
*   **Authors Notification (Position Papers):** January 30, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration (Position Papers):** February 12, 2025
*   **Late-Breaking Paper Submission:** January 23, 2025
*   **Authors Notification (Late-Breaking):** February 13, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration (Late-Breaking):** February 20, 2025
*   **Abstract Submission:** January 30, 2025
*   **Authors Notification (Abstracts):** February 13, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration (Abstracts):** February 28, 2025
*   **Workshops Proposal:** November 27, 2024
*   **Special Sessions Proposal:** November 27, 2024
*   **Tutorials Proposal:** February 18, 2025
*   **Demos Proposal:** February 18, 2025
*   **Panels Proposal:** February 18, 2025

*Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth".*

summary: The 18th Conference on Intelligent Computer Mathematics (CICM 2025) will be held in Brasilia, Brazil, from October 6-11, 2025. CICM aims to bring together communities working on automated deduction, computer algebra, and mathematical publishing to discuss integration and challenges in digital and computational mathematics. callForPapers:
# CICM 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th Conference on Intelligent Computer Mathematics (CICM 2025) will be held from **October 6-11, 2025**, in **Brasilia, Brazil**.

## About CICM

CICM brings together communities working on theoretical and practical solutions for mathematical applications such as computation, deduction, knowledge management, and user interfaces. It offers a venue for discussing problems and solutions in these areas and their integration.

## Topics of Interest

We are inviting formal submissions on all topics relating to intelligent computer mathematics, in particular, but not limited to:

*   theorem proving and computer algebra
*   mathematical knowledge management
*   digital mathematical libraries

A comprehensive list of topics of interest can be found on the conference website: [https://cicm-conference.org/2025/cicm.php?event=&menu=topics](https://cicm-conference.org/2025/cicm.php?event=&menu=topics)

## Invited Speakers

*   Fabian Huch, Technische Universität München (TUM)
*   Assia Mahboubi, INRIA, Nantes
*   Daniele Nantes Sobrinho, University of Brasilia (UnB)
*   Josef Urban, Czech Institute of of Informatics, Robotics and Cybernetics (CIIRC)
*   Joint Invited Speaker with LSFA 2025: Temur Kutsia, Research Institute for Symbolic Computation (RISC), Johannes Kepler University

## Formal Paper Submissions

Formal submissions will be reviewed rigorously and accepted papers will be published in a volume of Springer LNAI:

*   **Regular papers:** (up to 15 pages + bibliography) present novel research results.
*   **Project and survey papers:** (up to 15 pages + bibliography) summarize existing results.
*   **System and dataset descriptions:** (4 to 5 pages + bibliography) present digital artifacts.

## Doctoral Symposium

*   **Submission Type:** Two-page abstracts describing the focus and research questions of the PhD theses, along with details on completed research tasks and remaining research plans.
*   **Additional Submission:** A two-page CV of the applicant detailing background information (name, university, supervisor), education, employments, and relevant research experience.
*   **Chairs:** Claudia Nalon (UnB Brasilia) and Marcelo Finger (USP Sao Paulo).

## Important Dates

### Formal Submissions:

*   **Abstract deadline:** May 12, 2025
*   **Full paper deadline:** May 19, 2025
*   **Reviews sent to authors:** June 30, 2025
*   **Rebuttals due:** July 5, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 16, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies due:** July 28, 2025

### Conference Dates:

*   **Conference:** October 6-11, 2025

### Dates for Workshops:

*   **Workshop proposals:** April 29, 2025
*   **Notification:** May 03, 2025

### Dates for Doctoral Programme:

*   **Submission deadline:** August 15, 2025
*   **Notification to candidates:** September 15, 2025

## Submissions

All submissions should be made via EasyChair at [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cicm2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cicm2025) using the Springer LNCS style files: [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines)

If software or data is relevant to a paper, a link that provides access to the software/data must be provided to enable reproduction of results.

## Best Papers

CICM 2025 honors the best paper and best student paper with respect to reviews and program committee discussions with an award.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers for CHES 2025

The Workshop on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (CHES) is the premier venue for research in all aspects of cryptographic hardware and embedded systems. CHES 2025 will be held in **Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia**, from **September 14-18, 2025**.

Papers accepted and published by the *Transactions on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (TCHES)* journal during the 2025 volumes will be presented at CHES 2025.

## Scope and Topics

CHES focuses on research pertaining to **cryptographic hardware and embedded systems**. This includes, but is not limited to, the design and analysis of cryptographic primitives, implementations of cryptographic algorithms, attacks against implementations, and defenses against such attacks in various hardware and embedded contexts.

## Submission Process

Submissions to CHES are handled through the *Transactions on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (TCHES)* journal, which operates on a continuous submission model with four fixed deadlines per year. Authors are encouraged to submit their work to any of the upcoming TCHES volumes that align with the CHES 2025 presentation schedule.

Submissions are made via the dedicated submission portal for TCHES. Further details on the submission process, including formatting requirements and guidelines, are available on the [paper submission page](https://ches.iacr.org/2025/papersubmission.php).

## Important Dates for TCHES 2025 Issues

All submission deadlines are at **23:59:59 Anywhere on Earth (AoE)**.

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/1

*   **Submission deadline:** July 15, 2024
*   **Rebuttal phase:** August 19–23, 2024
*   **Notification:** September 15, 2024
*   **Final version due:** October 14, 2024

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/2

*   **Submission deadline:** October 15, 2024
*   **Rebuttal phase:** November 20–25, 2024
*   **Notification:** December 15, 2024
*   **Final version due:** January 14, 2025

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/3

*   **Submission deadline:** January 15, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** February 24–28, 2025
*   **Notification:** March 15, 2025
*   **Final version due:** April 14, 2025

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/4

*   **Submission deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** May 26–30, 2025
*   **Notification:** June 15, 2025
*   **Final version due:** July 14, 2025

> **Note:** The camera-ready deadline relates to (conditionally) accepted papers. Dates marked with an asterisk (*) indicate a deadline that was moved or extended.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be published in the *Transactions on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (TCHES)*. TCHES is an open-access journal published by the IACR.

## Conference Presentation

Authors of papers accepted and published in TCHES will be invited to present their work at the CHES 2025 conference in Kuala Lumpur.

summary: The International Conference on Hardware/Software Codesign and System Synthesis (CODES+ISSS) is part of the Embedded Systems Week (ESWEEK) 2025, taking place from September 28 to October 3, 2025, in Taipei, Taiwan. CODES+ISSS is a premier event focusing on system-level design, hardware/software co-design, and the implementation of Embedded Systems, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), and Internet-of-Things (IoT), serving as a forum for academic research and industrial practice.
callForPapers:
# CODES+ISSS: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Hardware/Software Codesign and System Synthesis (CODES+ISSS) is the premier event in system-level design, hardware/software co-design, modeling, analysis, and implementation of modern Embedded Systems, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), and Internet-of-Things (IoT), from system-level specification and optimization to system synthesis of multi-processor hardware/software implementations. The conference is a forum bringing together academic research and industrial practice for all aspects related to system-level and hardware/software co-design.

## Calls for Contribution

*   [Call for Papers](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/ESWeek2025_CFP.pdf)
*   [Call for Contributions](href="")
*   [Call for Special Sessions](https://esweek.org/call-for-special-session-proposals/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://esweek.org/call-for-tutorial-proposals-page/)
*   [Call for Workshops](https://esweek.org/call-for-workshop-proposals/)
*   [Call for LB (Late Breaking/Work-in-Progress Papers)](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ESWeek2023_CFP_LBWIP.pdf)
*   [Call for Artifacts (for EMSOFT)](https://esweek.org/call-for-artifacts/)

## Submission Tracks

*   **Journal Track:** For full research papers.
*   **Late Breaking Tracks:** For work-in-progress and other shorter contributions.
*   **Special Session Proposals:** Proposals for dedicated sessions on specific topics.
*   **Tutorial Proposals:** Proposals for educational tutorials.
*   **Workshops Proposals:** Proposals for co-located workshops.

## Important Dates

*   **March 23, 2025 (AOE):** Journal Track: Abstract Submission
*   **March 30, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Journal Track: Full Paper Submission, Special Session Proposals, Tutorial Proposals, Workshops Proposals
*   **May 18, 2025:** Journal track: First Round Notification
*   **June 01, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Late Breaking Tracks: Paper Submission
*   **June 15, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Journal track: Revised paper submission
*   **July 13, 2025:** Journal Track, Late Breaking Track: Notification
*   **August 11, 2025:** All tracks (full paper, LB, Special Session): Camera ready
*   **TBD:** Submission deadline for the Embedded System Software Competition (ESSC) and the ACM SIGBED Student Research Competition.

## Program Chairs

*   **Prabhat Mishra** (University of Florida, FL, US) - CODES+ISSS TPC Chair
*   **Paul Bogdan** (University of Southern California, CA, US) - CODES+ISSS TPC Co-Chair

## Submission

*   [Submit an Article to CODES+ISSS 2025](https://codesisss25.hotcrp.com/)
*   [Author Information](https://esweek.org/author-information/)

## About CODES+ISSS

CODES+ISSS is a conference within ESWEEK, focusing on the intersection of hardware and software for system synthesis and design, covering embedded systems, CPS, and IoT.

## ESWEEK 2025

ESWEEK 2025 will take place as an in-person event from September 28th to October 3rd, 2025, in Taipei, Taiwan.

callForPapers:
# CNSM 2025: Call for Papers

The 21st International Conference on Network and Service Management (CNSM) will be held in **Bologna, Italy**, from **October 27 to October 31, 2025**. The conference theme is **AI and Sustainability in the Future of Network and Service Management**.

CNSM is a selective single-track conference that covers all aspects of network and service management, pervasive systems, enterprises, and cloud computing environments.

## Important Dates

1.  **Paper Submission:** 6 July 2025 (extended, firm)
2.  **Rebuttal Period:** 20 - 22 August 2025
3.  **Notification of Acceptance:** 27 August 2025
4.  **Camera Ready Due:** 14 September 2025
5.  **Conference Dates:** 27 - 31 October 2025

## Submission Link

Submissions should be made electronically in PDF format through the EDAS system at: [https://edas.info/N33785](https://edas.info/N33785)

## Topics of Interest

*   **TECHNOLOGIES**
    *   Communication Protocols
    *   Middleware
    *   Overlay Networks
    *   Peer-to-Peer Networks
    *   Technologies for Computing Continuum
    *   5G/6G Networks
    *   Federated and Distributed Learning
    *   Generative AI and Large Language Models
    *   Green and Sustainable Networking
    *   Information Visualization
    *   Software-Defined Networking
    *   Monitoring and Measurements
    *   Multi-Access Edge Computing
    *   Network Function Virtualization
    *   Orchestration
    *   Operations and Business Support Systems
    *   Control and Data Plane Programmability
    *   Distributed Ledger Technology
    *   Digital Twins for Networks and Services
    *   Reinforcement Learning
    *   Secure and Dependable Networking
*   **SERVICE MANAGEMENT**
    *   Multimedia Services
    *   Content Delivery Services
    *   Cloud/Edge Computing Services
    *   Data Services
    *   Internet Connectivity and Internet Access Services
    *   Internet of Things Services
    *   Security Services
    *   Context-Aware Services
    *   Information Technology Services
    *   Service Assurance
*   **FUNCTIONAL AREAS**
    *   Fault Management
    *   Configuration Management
    *   Accounting Management
    *   Performance Management
    *   Security Management
*   **MANAGEMENT PARADIGMS**
    *   Centralized Management
    *   Hierarchical Management
    *   Distributed Management
    *   Federated Management
    *   Autonomic and Cognitive Management
    *   Policy- and Intent-Based Management
    *   Model-Driven Management
    *   Pro-Active Management
    *   Energy-Aware Management
    *   QoE-Centric Management
*   **METHODS**
    *   Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
    *   Mathematical Logic and Automated Reasoning
    *   Optimization Theories
    *   Control Theory
    *   Probability Theory, Stochastic Processes, and Queuing Theory
    *   Evolutionary Algorithms
    *   Economic Theory and Game Theory
    *   Data Mining and (Big) Data Analysis
    *   Computer Simulation Experiments
    *   Testbed Experimentation and Field Trials
    *   Software Engineering Methodologies

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors are invited to submit original contributions that have not been published or submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   Papers should be prepared using the **IEEE 2-column conference style**.
*   **Full papers** are limited to **9 pages** including references.
*   **Short papers** are limited to **5 pages** including references.
*   Papers exceeding page limits, multiple submissions, and self-plagiarized papers will be rejected without further review.
*   All other papers will get a thorough **single-blind review process**, followed by a rebuttal phase.

## Publication

Papers accepted and presented at CNSM 2025 will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore**, subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements. Authors of selected papers accepted for publication in the CNSM 2025 proceedings will be invited to submit an extended version of their papers to the **IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management journal**.

## Committees

### Technical Program Co-Chairs

*   Davide Borsatti, University of Bologna, Italy
*   Alberto Egon Schaeffer-Filho, Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
*   Daphné Tuncer, Institut Polytechnique de Paris, France

### General Co-Chairs

*   Walter Cerroni, University of Bologna, Italy
*   Mauro Tortonesi, University of Ferrara, Italy

## Social Media

You can find us on twitter: [https://twitter.com/cnsmconf](https://twitter.com/cnsmconf)
