callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IEEE Cluster 2025

IEEE Cluster 2025 is the 27th edition of the IEEE Cluster conference series, held in cooperation with SIGHPC. The conference will take place in **Edinburgh, United Kingdom, from September 2-5, 2025**.

Computing clusters are essential for high-performance computing, cloud computing, machine learning, and big data. This conference solicits high-quality original work advancing the state-of-the-art in clusters and related fields.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Format:** PDF, conforming to IEEE Xplore layout (single-spaced, 2-column numbered pages, 8.5x11-inch paper, margins: top: 0.75, bottom: 1.0, sides:0.625, between columns:0.25, main text: 10pt).
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum 10 pages (excluding references).
*   **Review Process:** Dual-anonymous review. Author names and affiliations should NOT be included in the submitted paper. For more details, refer to [https://clustercomp.org/2025/dual_anonymous.html](https://clustercomp.org/2025/dual_anonymous.html).
*   **AI-Generated Text:** Disclosure of AI-generated content is required in the acknowledgments section, identifying the AI system used and the extent of its use. See [IEEE Submission Policies](https://conferences.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/author-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-policies/) for more details.
*   **Templates:** LaTeX and Word Templates are available [here](https://clustercomp.org/2025/authors/).
*   **Submission System:** Submit your paper via the [online submission system](https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/ieeecluster/).
*   **Presentation Requirement:** For an accepted paper to be included in the proceedings, at least one author must register, attend in person, and present the paper at the conference.

## Topic Areas

Authors must indicate the primary topic area of their submissions. Transversal and emerging topics are welcome.

### Area 1: Application, Algorithms, and Libraries

*   HPC and Big Data application studies on large-scale clusters
*   Applications at the boundary of HPC and Big Data
*   New applications for converged HPC/Big Data clusters
*   Application-level performance and energy modeling and measurement
*   Novel algorithms on clusters
*   Hybrid programming techniques in applications and libraries (e.g., MPI+X)
*   Cluster benchmarks
*   Application-level libraries on clusters
*   Effective use of clusters in novel applications
*   Performance evaluation tools

### Area 2: Architecture, Network/Communications, and Management

*   Node and system architecture for HPC and Big Data clusters
*   Architecture for converged HPC/Big Data clusters
*   Energy-efficient cluster architectures
*   Packaging, power and cooling
*   Accelerators, reconfigurable and domain-specific hardware
*   Heterogeneous clusters
*   Interconnect/memory architectures
*   Single system/distributed image clusters
*   Administration, monitoring and maintenance tools

### Area 3: Programming and System Software

*   Cluster system software/operating systems
*   Programming models for converged HPC/Big Data/Machine Learning systems
*   System software supporting the convergence of HPC, Big Data, and Machine Learning processing
*   Cloud-enabling cluster technologies and virtualization
*   Energy-efficient middleware
*   Cluster system-level protocols and APIs
*   Cluster security
*   Management of local, center-wide and disaggregate resources and job
*   Programming and software development environments on clusters
*   Fault tolerance and high-availability
*   Administration, monitoring and maintenance tools

### Area 4: Data, Storage, and Visualization

*   Cluster architectures for Big Data storage and processing
*   Middleware for Big Data management
*   Cluster-based cloud architectures for Big Data
*   Storage systems supporting the convergence of HPC and Big Data processing
*   File systems and I/O libraries
*   Support and integration of non-volatile memory
*   Visualization clusters and tiled displays
*   Big Data/Large scale visualization tools
*   Big Data application studies on cluster architectures

## Important Dates

*   Submission site open: **February 3, 2025**
*   Full Papers due: **May 6, 2025**
*   Paper Acceptance Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   Camera-ready deadline: **August 8, 2025**
*   Conference: **September 2--5, 2025**

All deadlines are Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

## Contact

**Program Co-Chairs:**
*   Adrian Jackson, EPCC, University of Edinburgh, United Kingdom
*   Toni Peña, Barcelona Supercomputing Centre, Spain

Complete committee list is available [here](https://clustercomp.org/2025/committees/).

callForPapers:
# CHI 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems is the premier international conference dedicated to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI).

## Conference Details

*   **Theme:** Ikigai (a Japanese concept referring to what gives a person a sense of purpose, a reason for living).
*   **Location:** Yokohama, Japan, at the PACIFICO Yokohama.
*   **Dates:** April 26 to May 1, 2025.
*   **Participation:** Onsite and remote attendance options are available.

## Submission Types and Deadlines

All times are in Anywhere on Earth (AoE) time zone.

### Papers

*   Submission Site Open: **August 1, 2024**
*   Abstract/metadata deadline: **September 5, 2024** (Hard deadline for all author names and metadata).
*   Full paper deadline: **September 12, 2024**
*   Video figures (optional) and Supplementary Material deadline: **September 19, 2024**
*   Reviews Released: **November 5, 2024**
*   Revise Papers: November 6 – December 10, 2024
*   Resubmission deadline: **December 10, 2024**
*   PC Meeting: **January 14, 2025**
*   Decision Notification: **January 16, 2025**

### Other Submission Tracks (Selected Deadlines)

*   **Case Studies of HCI in Practice & Courses:**
    *   Submission: **October 10, 2024**
    *   Notification: **November 28, 2024**
*   **Workshops:**
    *   Submission: **October 24, 2024**
    *   Notification: **December 5, 2024**
*   **In-Person Doctoral Consortium:**
    *   Submission: **December 5, 2024**
    *   Notification: **January 30, 2025**
*   **alt.CHI, Panels, SIG:**
    *   Submission: **December 19, 2024**
    *   Notification: **January 16, 2025**
*   **Journals:**
    *   Submission: **January 22, 2025**
    *   Notification: **January 27, 2025**
*   **Student Volunteer:**
    *   Submission: **January 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **February 20, 2025**
*   **Late Breaking Work, Interactivity, Remote Doctoral Consortium, Student Design Competition, Student Game Competition, Student Research Competition, Video Showcase:**
    *   Submission: Deadlines vary, please refer to the specific track pages.

## Submission Guidelines for Papers

*   **Originality:** Submissions must be original and not published or under concurrent review elsewhere. Multiple distinct submissions are allowed.
*   **Paper Length:**
    *   Short Papers: 5,000 words or less (excluding references, captions, appendices).
    *   Standard-Length Papers: 5,000 to 12,000 words (approx. 7,000-8,000 words on average).
    *   Submissions over 12,000 words require strong justification and may be desk rejected.
*   **Stand-Alone Requirement:** Papers must be self-contained. All crucial information must be in the main text; appendices are optional for reviewers.
*   **Format:**
    *   Use the correct href="https://chi2025.acm.org/chi-publication-formats/" - CHI 2025 template .
    *   A single-column format is required for the reviewing phase.
*   **Anonymization:** Submissions must be anonymized according to the href="https://chi2025.acm.org/submission-guides/chi-anonymization-policy/" - Anonymization Policy . Violations may result in desk rejection.
*   **Accessibility:** Follow the href="https://sigchi.org/resources/guides-for-authors/accessibility/" - SIGCHI Guide to an Accessible Submission . Contact accessibility@chi2025.acm.org for assistance.
*   **Inclusivity:** Ensure work and writing are inclusive. Acknowledge if inclusivity is not possible. Use gender-inclusive language.
*   **Large Language Models (LLMs):** Text generated by LLMs must be clearly marked. Refer to ACM's Policy on Authorship and the SIGCHI blog for guidance.
*   **Human Participants:** Research involving human subjects must meet applicable ethics review requirements. Provide a short note to reviewers regarding context.
*   **Concurrent Submissions:** Closely related submissions to other venues must be declared. Failure to do so may result in desk rejection.
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Optional video figures and supplementary materials (code, data, etc.) must also be anonymized. They should not be necessary for understanding the core contribution of the paper.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submissions must be made through the href="https://new.precisionconference.com/" - Precision Conference Submission Portal .

## Review Process

*   **Revise and Resubmit:** Papers exceeding a certain threshold may undergo a revise and resubmit phase.
*   **Quality:** Papers are evaluated for originality, significance, validity, research quality, and presentation clarity.

## Video Presentation (Mandatory)

All accepted authors are required to upload a video presentation by **Thursday, March 13, 2025**.

## Publication

Accepted papers appear in the ACM Digital Library. Authors can choose between Gold and Green open access options. Extended versions may be invited for IARIA Journals.

## Contact Us

*   **Papers Chairs:** Phoebe Toups-Dugas, Bongshin Lee, Marshini Chetty
*   **Email:** href="mailto:papers@chi2025.acm.org" - papers@chi2025.acm.org

© 2025 | ACM SIGCHI

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 31st International Computing and Combinatorics Conference (COCOON 2025) will be held in **Chengdu, China** during **August 15-17, 2025**.

Original research papers in the areas of algorithms, theory of computation, computational complexity, and combinatorics related to computing are solicited. In addition to theoretical results, submissions that report on experimental and applied research of general algorithmic interest are also welcomed. Special consideration will be given to research motivated by real-world problems. Experimental and applied papers are expected to convincingly demonstrate the usefulness and efficiency of the algorithms discussed in a practical setting.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission:** March 5, 2025, 23:59 AoE
*   **Notification:** May 5, 2025 AoE
*   **Camera-ready:** May 20, 2024 AoE
*   **Conference:** August 15 – August 17, 2025

*(AoE: Anywhere on Earth time, UTC -12 hours)*

## Topics of Interest

The topics of interest include (but are not limited to):

*   Algorithms and Data Structures
*   Algorithmic Game Theory and Mechanism Design
*   Approximation Algorithms and Online Algorithms
*   Automata, Languages, Logic, and Computability
*   Combinatorics Related to Algorithms and Complexity
*   Complexity Theory
*   Computational Learning Theory and Knowledge Discovery
*   Cryptography, Reliability and Security, and Database Theory
*   Computational Biology and Bioinformatics
*   Computational Algebra, Geometry, and Number Theory
*   Exact and Parameterized Algorithms
*   Graph Drawing and Information Visualization
*   Graph Theory, Communication Networks, and Optimization
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing

## Paper Submission

Submissions should contain a scholarly exposition of ideas, techniques, and results, including motivation and a clear comparison with related work. The length of the submission should not exceed **12 pages in LNCS style** (including references, but excluding the optional appendix).

Springer’s proceedings LaTeX templates are available [here](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-templates).

Appendices should be placed at the end of the main body (after references, in the same file). For code and data, authors can provide anonymous download links or refer to an anonymized GitHub repository. The Program Committee (PC) will review the content in the appendices and links at their discretion.

The submitted papers will be reviewed in a **double-blind peer review manner**. Please delete the author information on your manuscript.

All submissions must be submitted electronically through Easychair via this link: [https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=cocoon2025](https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=cocoon2025)

## Publication

The proceedings of the conference will be published by **Springer-Verlag in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series**, and will be available for distribution at the conference. Selected high-quality papers will be invited for submission to some journals. Previous COCOON proceedings can be found [here](https://link.springer.com/conference/cocoon).

## Awards

Awards will be given to the **Best Paper** and the **Best Student Paper**. To be eligible for the best student paper award, all authors must be full-time students at the time of submission. Please indicate in the final line of the abstract that the paper is being considered for the best student paper award. The program committee reserves the right to withhold these awards or to split them between multiple recipients.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CISIS 2025

The **18th International Conference on Computational Intelligence in Security for Information Systems (CISIS 2025)** aims to provide a platform for academic and industry researchers from the fields of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining.

The conference will take place in **Salamanca, Spain**, from **October 16-17, 2025**. CISIS 2025 is part of a larger congress including the International Joint Conferences HAIS 2025, SOCO 2025, and ICEUTE 2025.

## About CISIS

CISIS aims to offer a meeting opportunity for academic and industry-related researchers belonging to the various, vast communities of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining. The need for intelligent, flexible behaviour by large, complex systems, especially in mission-critical domains, is intended to be the catalyst and the aggregation stimulus for the overall event.

## Topics

For a detailed list of topics, please visit the [Topics page](http://cisisconference.eu/topics/).

## Special Issues

Accepted papers (from the general track and special sessions) will be considered for possible inclusion in a special issue of **Neurocomputing (ELSEVIER)**.

## Special Sessions

Proposals for special sessions are open until **15th March 2025**. Organizers are responsible for:

*   Selecting a topic of interest to delegates.
*   Obtaining a minimum of 5 papers (at least 60% from authors not involved in the session as chairs, team members, or reviewers).
*   Managing the review process within deadlines and providing suitable reviewers.
*   Ensuring final versions of papers are uploaded before the deadline.
*   Attending the conference and chairing the session.
*   Disseminating the call for papers for the special session.

To submit a special session proposal, please send an e-mail to hector.quintian@udc.es including:

*   Title of the special session and selected conference (SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25)
*   Name of chair/co-chairs, email/s and affiliation/s
*   A description of the session content (one or two paragraphs).
*   A list of at least 10 international reviewers (including chairs) from at least three different universities (name, family name, email, affiliation).
*   Description of the plan to disseminate the special session (CFPs, etc).

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** 15th March 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** 1st June 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** 15th June 2025
*   **Submission of revised papers:** 30th June 2025
*   **Final version submission:** 5th July 2025
*   **Payment deadline:** 10th July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 16th – 17th October 2025

## Paper Submission & Publication

*   **Proceedings:** SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25 proceedings will be published by **Springer in Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (LNNS)**. They will be indexed by SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago.
*   **Paper Length:** Papers must be prepared according to the LNNS style template and must be no more than **ten (10) pages long**, including figures and bibliography. Additional pages (over 10 pages) will be charged **150 euros** for each page.
*   **Submission System:** All submissions must be made through the EasyChair system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025)
*   **Presentation Requirement:** All accepted papers must be presented by one of the authors who must register for the conference and pay the fee.

## Committees

### General Chair
*   Dr. Emilio Corchado (University of Salamanca, Spain)

### Co-Chairs
*   Dr. Alicia Troncoso Lora (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Hilde Pérez García (University of León, Spain)
*   Dr. Esteban Jove (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. José Luis Calvo Rolle (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Javier Martínez de Pisón (University of La Rioja, Spain)
*   Dr. Pablo García Bringas (University of Deusto, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Martínez Álvarez (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Alvaro Herrero Cosio (University of Burgos, Spain)
*   Dr. Paolo Fosci (University of Bergamo, Italy)
*   Dr. Héctor Quintián (University of A Coruña, Spain)

## Sponsors

*   Startup OLÉ
*   BISITE

## Contact

For conference-related issues or doubts, please contact: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es)

callForPapers:
# CGO 2025: Call for Papers

The International Symposium on Code Generation and Optimization (CGO’25) will be held in **Las Vegas, USA**, from **March 1st to March 5th, 2025**. CGO is the premier venue to bring together researchers and practitioners working at the interface of hardware and software on a wide range of optimization and code generation techniques and related issues. The conference spans the spectrum from purely static to fully dynamic approaches, and from pure software-based methods to specific architectural features and support for code generation and optimization.

CGO will be held in conjunction with PPoPP, CC, and HPCA.

CGO uses a **two-submission-per-year model**. Papers submitted to the first round can either be directly accepted, rejected, or invited to submit a revised version for the second round.

## Topics

Original contributions are solicited on, but not limited to, the following topics:

*   Code Generation, Translation, Transformation, and Optimization for performance, energy, virtualization, portability, security, or reliability concerns, and architectural support
*   Efficient execution of dynamically typed and higher-level languages
*   Optimization and code generation for emerging programming models, platforms, domain-specific languages
*   Dynamic/static, profile-guided, feedback-directed, and machine learning-based optimization
*   Static, Dynamic, and Hybrid Analysis for performance, energy, memory locality, throughput or latency, security, reliability, or functional debugging
*   Program characterization methods
*   Profiling and instrumentation techniques; architectural support
*   Novel and efficient tools
*   Compiler design, practice and experience
*   Compiler abstraction and intermediate representations
*   Vertical integration of language features, representations, optimizations, and runtime support for parallelism
*   Solutions that involve cross-layer (HW/OS/VM/SW) design and integration
*   Deployed dynamic/static compiler and runtime systems for general purpose, embedded system and Cloud/HPC platforms
*   Parallelism, heterogeneity, and reconfigurable architectures
*   Optimizations for heterogeneous or specialized targets, GPUs, SoCs, CGRA and Quantum Computers
*   Compiler support for vectorization, thread extraction, task scheduling, speculation, transaction, memory management, data distribution and synchronization

## Submission Guidelines

### General Requirements

*   The paper must be original material that has not been previously published or is currently under review by another conference or journal.
*   Submissions are limited to **eleven (11) letter-size (8.5"x11") pages**, excluding references. An appendix is allowed with no page limit, but reviewers are not required to read it. Papers must be self-contained.
*   **Format:** ACM format (using the sample-sigplan.tex template).
*   **Language:** English.
*   **File Format:** PDF only.
*   **Printing:** Must be formatted for black-and-white printers; readable graphs are essential; pages must be numbered.
*   **Fonts:** Use of Times, Helvetica, Courier, and Symbol is suggested.

### Double-Blind Review

*   Papers are to be submitted for double-blind review. Author names and identifying information must be removed.
*   Reference prior work by yourself in the third person, as if extending someone else's research.

### Author Responsibilities

*   Authors must register all their conflicts of interest on the submission site.
*   ORCID IDs are required for publication.
*   Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies.

## Tool and Practical Experience Papers

*   This category requires either a clear account of a tool's functionality or a summary of practical experience with realistic case studies.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Mandatory for Tool Papers; optional for Practical Experience Papers. Successful evaluation is required for final acceptance.
*   **Criteria:** Originality, Usability, Documentation, Benchmark Repository, Availability, Foundations, Artifact Evaluation.
*   Same page limit (11 pages excluding references) and format as regular papers.

## Geographic Diversity and Inclusion

*   Remote presentation is allowed for authors unable to travel due to reasons beyond their control (e.g., visa issues).
*   Efforts will be made to make attendance affordable, especially for students from under-represented countries.

## Artifact Evaluation

*   A separate committee assesses artifacts to improve reproducibility. Papers with successful AE will receive a seal of approval.
*   Authors can indicate interest in submitting an artifact at the time of paper submission.

## Submission Site

*   [https://cgo25-second-round.hotcrp.com/](https://cgo25-second-round.hotcrp.com/)

## Deadlines (AoE - UTC-12h)

**First Submission Round (R1):**

*   **Submission Deadline:** **May 30, 2024**
*   Author Rebuttal Period: July 9-11, 2024
*   Paper Notification: July 22, 2024

**Second Submission Round (R2):**

*   **Submission Deadline:** **September 12, 2024**
*   Author Rebuttal Period: October 22 - 24, 2024
*   Paper Notification: November 4, 2024

## Program Committee

*   **Co-chairs:** Hugh Leather (Meta), P. (Saday) Sadayappan (University of Utah)

(A full list of program committee members is available on the conference website.)

summary: Computability in Europe (CiE) 2025 is an interdisciplinary conference series by the Association Computability in Europe (ACiE), focusing on research related to computability. callForPapers:
# Computability in Europe 2025 (CiE 2025): Call for Papers

Computability in Europe (CiE) is an interdisciplinary series of international conferences organized by the Association Computability in Europe (ACiE). CiE brings together both basic and application-oriented research in computability-related areas of science.

The **CiE 2025** conference will be held in **Lisbon, Portugal, from July 14 to July 18, 2025**.

## Topics of Interest

The conference welcomes research contributions on computability-related fields of science, including:

*   Mathematics
*   Theoretical Computer Science
*   Logic
*   Quantum Computability
*   Cryptography
*   Information Theory
*   Computational Biology
*   Computational Linguistics
*   History and Philosophy of Computability
*   And many other related subjects.

## Deadlines and Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission:** January 26, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Full Paper Submission:** February 2, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 6, 2025
*   **Final Versions Due:** April 13, 2025
*   **Informal Presentations Submission:** April 22, 2025
*   **Early Registration:** Before May 6, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 14-18, 2025

## Participant Support

*   **Women in Computability:** As part of the program, support is offered for junior women researchers to join CiE 2025. See the details [here](https://sites.google.com/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).
*   **Student Travel Support:** The Association for Symbolic Logic will support the travels of some students. More information can be found [here](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).

## Submission Information

Information regarding the submission process can be found on the [conference home page](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/home).

callForPapers:
# IEEE CoG 2025: Call for Papers

The annual IEEE Conference on Games (IEEE CoG 2025) is a leading scientific research venue for game researchers and practitioners. Games offer a fantastic domain for computational creativity, game design, technology, education, social sciences, and artificial and computational intelligence. IEEE CoG 2025 will be held at the Técnico Innovation Center, Instituto Superior Técnico in Lisbon, Portugal, from **August 26th to 29th, 2025**.

## Submission Types

We invite the submission of:

*   **Full technical papers:** Should provide a technical or empirical contribution to scientific, technical, or engineering aspects of games. Limit: 8 pages (including references and appendices).
*   **Full vision papers:** Should describe a vision for the future of the Games field or some part of it, be based on extensive research, and include a comprehensive bibliography. Please note that literature reviews and opinion papers with speculations not grounded in research are immediately rejected. Limit: 8 pages (including references and appendices).

## Topics of Interest

We invite contributions related to all aspects of games and game development, including, but not limited to:

*   Accessibility and inclusivity in games (e.g., computer games, board games, LARPs)
*   AI for game development (automated playtesting, adaptation/personalization in games, etc.)
*   Esports and live-streaming
*   Extended reality (virtual reality, mixed reality, and augmented reality)
*   Game AI
*   Game analytics, game data science, and data visualization
*   Games as test-beds for algorithms
*   Game design (frameworks, game mechanics, etc.)
*   Game editors and authoring tools
*   Game technology (game engines, graphics, audio, animation, physics, controls, etc.)
*   Game user research (player/opponent modeling, player experience studies, psychology of play and player types, etc.)
*   Generative AI for games
*   Procedural content generation
*   Serious/applied games (for education, health, sustainability, etc.)
*   User interfaces in games

## Tracks

Authors should select the track that best matches their research. Descriptions for each track are listed below:

*   **1) AI and Game-playing:** Suitable for computational and artificial intelligence applications in digital and non-digital games, except for procedural content generation. Topics include general game-playing AI, mixed-initiative authoring tools, believable agents, and AI-assisted game design and testing.
    *   Track chairs: Diego-Perez Liebana (diego.perez@qmul.ac.uk) and Kyung-Joong Kim (kjkim@gist.ac.kr)
*   **2) Procedural Content Generation (PCG):** Focuses on advancing research on developing and evaluating algorithms that automatically create game design and content such as levels, maps, characters, stories, textures, and music. Theoretical papers are welcome.
    *   Track chairs: Antonios Liapis (an.liapis@gmail.com) and Ahmed Khalifa (ahmed.khalifa@um.edu.mt)
*   **3) Designing Games, Serious Games and Playful Experience:** Welcomes papers that make a designerly contribution to games, playful interaction, and other playable media. A broad range of submissions advancing practical or theoretical understanding of designing games, playful interactions, and player experience in various contexts are welcome.
    *   Track chairs: Casper Harteveld (c.harteveld@northeastern.edu)
*   **4) Game Technology:** Invites papers that improve the technical aspects of game design and development besides AI and robotics. Typical contributions include game engines, benchmarks, computer graphics techniques, animation, networking, and novel interaction technology (e.g., XR and alternative control). Papers about game competitions are also a good fit.
    *   Track chairs: Christopher Salge (C.Salge@herts.ac.uk) and Johannes Pfau (j.pfau@uu.nl)
*   **5) Game HCI, Player Experience, Game Analytics, e-sports:** Suitable for submissions that seek to understand people in the context of play. Example topics include player experience evaluation (player psychology, games user research, and game analytics), the study of player and developer communities, and understanding humans in the context of play.
    *   Track chairs: Alessandro Canossa (acan@kglakademi.dk) and Erica Kleinman (e.kleinman@northeastern.edu)
*   **6) Robots in Games:** (Implicitly covered under other tracks, or to be confirmed based on specific content not fully detailed here)

*Note: CoG is not a conference about game theory unless it is applied to playable games (video or board games).* 

## Important Dates

All times **Anytime on Earth (AoE)**:

*   **Call for Full Papers:** March 15, 2025 (Closed)
*   **Full papers acceptance notification:** May 16, 2025 (Closed)
*   **Full papers camera ready:** June 13, 2025
*   **Call for Auxiliary Papers:** May 30, 2025 (Open)
*   **Call for Doctoral Consortium:** May 30, 2025 (Open)
*   Call for Competitions: January 19, 2025 (Closed)
*   Call for Tutorials: January 19, 2025 (Closed)
*   Call for Workshops: January 19, 2025 (Closed)

## Submission Instructions

*   Papers and Auxiliary papers must be submitted through the Easychair conference submission system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cog2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cog2025)
*   All paper submissions should follow the recommended IEEE conference author guidelines. MS Word and LaTeX templates can be found at: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   CoG will use a **double-blind review process**. Authors must omit their names and affiliations from their submissions and avoid obvious identifying statements. Submissions not abiding by anonymity requirements will be desk rejected.

## Camera-Ready Submission

Here are the steps to generate and submit your camera-ready paper:

1.  Create an account at IEEE PDF eXpress: [https://ieee-pdf-express.org/account/Login](https://ieee-pdf-express.org/account/Login) using the Conference ID: **64752X**.
2.  Upload your manuscript and generate your IEEE Xplore-Compatible PDF. Ensure it complies with IEEE guidelines: [https://ieee-pdf-express.org/External/UsingIEEEPDFeXpress](https://ieee-pdf-express.org/External/UsingIEEEPDFeXpress).
3.  Log in to EasyChair using your account and go to your proceedings author page.
4.  Upload your final IEEE Xplore-Compatible PDF.
5.  Complete the IEEE Copyright Agreement, which will be provided via email.

## Contact

*   Email: [cog2025@inesc-id.pt](mailto:cog2025@inesc-id.pt)

## Code of Conduct

IEEE CoG 2025 adheres to IEEE’s nondiscrimination policy and Code of Ethics, committing to a harassment-free, accessible, and pleasant conference experience for all participants. Participants can contact any member of the Organization in confidence or use IEEE’s Ethics Reporting Line.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - CoDIT 2025

The 11th International Conference on Control, Decision and Information Technologies (CoDIT 2025) will be held in a **hybrid format**, allowing both virtual and in-person participation, from **July 15-18, 2025**, at **Split, Croatia**.

## Welcome

CoDIT 2025 serves as a forum for technical exchange among scientists interested in Control, Automation, Robotics, Optimization, Decision, Cybernetics, Computer Science, and Information Technologies. It offers an exceptional platform for both academic and industrial communities to tackle new challenges, share solutions, and explore future research directions.

## Call for Contributed Papers

All papers must be written in English and should describe original work.

All registered and presented papers (Regular and Short-WiP) will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore** as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.

### Regular Papers

*   The length of the paper is limited to a maximum of **6 pages** (in the standard IEEE conference double-column format).
*   Registered and presented regular papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.
*   Papers will be refereed through a **blind process** for technical merit and content.
*   To be eligible for publication in the Conference proceedings, an accepted paper must be presented at the Conference by one of the authors.
*   You can send your work as a regular paper or send it to one of the accepted special sessions.
*   Papers should be submitted before **April 30, 2025**.

### Short Papers (Work-in-Progress / WiP)

*   The length of WiP paper is limited to a maximum of **4 pages**.
*   At most **8 references** can be included.
*   WiP (short papers) contributors are expected to give a **short presentation** of their work (10 mn).

## Templates for Authors

The submitted papers should follow the usual IEEE paper format for conferences (two-columns, 10 point, Times New Roman).

Templates are available for:

*   [LaTeX](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)
*   [MS Word](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)

## Call for Special Sessions

*   The goal of special sessions (5-6 papers) and special tracks (at least two sessions) is to provide focused discussions on new topics or innovative applications.
*   Each prospective session/track organizer must submit a proposal, including the title of the session, a short description, and the organizer's name.
*   Proposals should be submitted before **January 17, 2025**.
*   To submit your proposal, please fill in the form inside the following MS Word file, convert it as PDF, and upload the generated PDF to the PaperCept Conference Management System at: [https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl](https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl) (click on the CoDIT 2024 link “Submit a special session to CoDIT 2025” and follow the steps).

## Key Dates

*   **Submission site opening:** November 07, 2024
*   **Special session Proposal:** January 17, 2025
*   **Papers submission deadline:** April 30, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** April 27, 2025 (for papers submitted by April 7) / May 10, 2025 (for papers submitted after April 7).
*   **Final version due:** May 27, 2025
*   **Registration deadline:** May 27, 2025

## Publications & Special Issues

Along with the publication of the proceedings in IEEE Xplore, the best-presented papers at CoDIT 2025 will have the opportunity to be extended and published in prestigious special issues:

*   International Journal of Dynamics and Control (Impact Factor: 2.2)
*   Transactions of the Institute of Measurement and Control (Impact Factor: 1.7)
*   Computational Optimization and Applications (Impact Factor: 1.6)

## Registration

Registration for CoDIT 2025 should be made online by CREDIT CARD at: [Registration Link](https://controls-registration.paperhost.net/codit25/)

callForPapers:
# IEEE CLOUD 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2025) invites researchers, practitioners, and innovators to submit original papers addressing all aspects of cloud computing infrastructure, technologies, applications, and business innovations.

## Conference Details

*   **Conference:** IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2025)
*   **Part of:** 2025 IEEE World Congress on SERVICES
*   **Dates:** July 7-12, 2025
*   **Location:** Helsinki, Finland
*   **Sponsorship:** Solely sponsored by the IEEE Computer Society under the auspice of the Technical Community on Services Computing (TCSVC).

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

### Cloud Architecture and Infrastructure

*   Data center architectures
*   Virtualization and multi-tenancy
*   Cloud storage
*   Cloud-native programming models (serverless, microservices, service mesh, etc.)
*   Software-based networking technologies (SDN, NFV)
*   Multi-cloud and cloud federation environments
*   Private and hybrid cloud environments
*   Edge and fog computing infrastructure

### Cloud Management and Operation

*   Performance monitoring and optimization
*   Fault tolerance, high availability, and reliability
*   Resource allocation and scheduling
*   Load balancing and automated scaling
*   Cost optimization strategies
*   DevOps, CI/CD, IaC and cloud automation
*   Optimizing AI workloads on heterogeneous infrastructure
*   Optimizing heterogeneous infrastructure for AI workloads

### Sustainable Cloud Computing

*   Carbon footprint measurement for hardware and software systems
*   Carbon-aware and grid-aware system management
*   Sustainable data center design
*   Sustainable software development practices for cloud services
*   Energy-efficient service architectures
*   Green cloud architectures and solutions

### Cloud Security and Privacy

*   Trusted environments and Zero trust architectures
*   Identity and access management, authorization, and authentication
*   Assurance, audit, certification, regulatory compliance
*   Privacy-aware and cross-data center data management

### Cloud Computing in Emerging Technologies

*   AI and ML in cloud environments
*   Edge intelligence & AI analytics at the edge
*   IoT cloud platforms
*   Digital twins & metaverse Applications
*   Quantum computing integration
*   5G/6G and cloud integration
*   Blockchain in cloud services

### Cloud Economics

*   Strategies for enterprise business transformation
*   Cloud Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
*   Economic and business models for XaaS (including RoI analysis)
*   Economic models for AI cloud deployments
*   Adaptive pricing strategies
*   Cross-cloud market mechanisms

## Submission Information

*   Authors are invited to prepare early and submit original papers.
*   Submissions can be made through [www.easychair.org](http://www.easychair.org).
*   All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least three reviewers.
*   Accepted and presented papers will appear in the conference proceedings published by the IEEE Computer Society Press.

## Key Dates

*   **Early Bird Registration Deadline:** June 20

callForPapers:
# CloudCom 2025: Call for Papers

CloudCom is a premier international conference on Cloud Computing, bringing together researchers, practitioners, engineers, and students from both academia and industry. It has a long tradition of emphasizing how to build cloud computing platforms with impact. The conference is co-sponsored by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) and the Cloud Computing Association.

The 16th edition of CloudCom will be held in **Shenzhen, China**, from **November 14 to 16, 2025**. It attracts world-class researchers to explore new challenges, present leading-edge innovations, and identify emerging technologies in cloud computing, edge computing, virtualization, security and privacy, big data, systems architecture, service-oriented architecture, and high-performance computing.

## Submission Details

Original and unpublished work must be submitted through the online submission system at: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cloudcom2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cloudcom2025)

*   **Page Limit:** Submissions should not exceed **8 pages**, including tables, figures, and references.
*   **Format:** Papers must be in IEEE CS format. Template files for LATEX or WORD can be downloaded from the IEEE site [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html). Submissions must be in PDF format only with savable text and embedded fonts.
*   **Review Process:** The review process will be **doubly blind**. Submissions should not include any information that may identify the authors.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** For each accepted submission, at least one of the co-authors must have a full conference registration and present the work in person.

## Special Sections

CloudCom 2025 invites contributions for the following special sections:

*   Semantic Communication
*   Federated Learning
*   Secure Distributed ML
*   AIoT for Smart Cities
*   Sustainable Blockchain

## Conference Tracks

Original technical submissions of regular research papers, workshop proposals, and special session proposals on the following tracks are invited:

### Track 1: Architecture, Storage, and Virtualization
*   Cloud architecture, virtualization technologies, containers and microservices, cloud storage systems, scalability and performance, etc.

### Track 2: Cloud Services and Applications
*   Software as a Service (SaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), serverless computing, etc.

### Track 3: Security, Privacy, and Trust
*   Cloud security and privacy, data protection, identity and access management, security compliance, risk assessment, etc.

### Track 4: IoT and Distributed Cloud
*   Cloud-IoT integration, distributed cloud computing, IoT architecture and platforms, IoT data analytics, etc.

### Track 5: Cloud and Edge Computing with Mobile Communications
*   Edge computing architecture, fog computing, mobile cloud computing, cloud-edge collaboration, 5G and 6G networks, etc.

### Track 6: AI for Cloud Computing
*   AI for Cloud Infrastructure Management, AI-enhanced Cloud Services, AI for Cloud Security, AI for Data Management and Storage, Cloud-native AI Model Deployment

### Track 7: Integrating Large Models and Distributed Cloud Computing in Next-Generation Networks
*   Large model deployment in distributed clouds, Distributed cloud computing for large models, Generative AI for next-generation networks, Scalability and efficiency of large models in distributed cloud computing, System architectures for large model reasoning and training, Dynamic scalability model for cloud services

### Track 8: Cloud/Edge Computing for E-Health
*   Autonomous computing for E-Health, Biomedical and biosensor computing for E-Health, Real-time health monitoring and remote diagnosis, Data integration and privacy protection for E-Health, Intelligent medical equipment and robots, Personalized medical care and health management

## Publications

Accepted papers will be published in the **IEEE CloudCom 2025 Conference Proceedings** and submitted to **IEEE Xplore** and **EI Compendex** for indexing.

In addition, selected high-quality papers will be recommended for fast-track publication in the following journals after acceptable extensions:

*   IEEE Transactions on Cloud Computing
*   The Journal of Cloud Computing by Springer

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop Proposal Deadline:** June 1, 2025
*   **Special Session/Workshop Proposal Notification:** July 1, 2025
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** August 15, 2025
*   **Paper Acceptance Notification:** October 4, 2025
*   **Author Notification:** October 4, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready & Author Registration Deadline:** October 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** November 14-16, 2025

*All deadlines are at 23:59 Anywhere on Earth (AOE).* 

## Contact Us

*   **Email:** [cloudcom2025@163.com](mailto:cloudcom2025@163.com)
*   **Location:** Shenzhen, China

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: Conference on Information Sciences and Systems (CISS)

The Conference on Information Sciences and Systems (CISS) is a premier forum for scientists, engineers, and academics to present their latest research results and developments.

## About CISS

Hosted by the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Johns Hopkins University, and with technical co-sponsorship by the IEEE Information Theory Society, CISS provides a platform for exchanging ideas and findings in multiple areas of Information Sciences and Systems.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to present unpublished papers describing theoretical advances, applications, and ideas in the following fields:

*   Information Theory, Communications, and Coding
*   Energy Systems
*   Signal and Image Processing
*   Systems and Control
*   Deep Learning
*   Networked Systems
*   Optimization
*   Quantum Systems
*   Machine Learning
*   Security and Privacy
*   Statistical Inference
*   Big Data Analytics
*   Biological Systems
*   Computer Vision
*   Cyber Physical Systems
*   Reinforcement Learning

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Dates:** March 24th until March 26th, 2027

## Submission Information

*   **Paper Submission:** [https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=3541](https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=3541)
*   **Author Information:** [https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=3563](https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=3563)
*   **Final Paper Submission:** [https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=6180](https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=6180)

## Registration Information

*   **Conference Registration:** [https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=67](https://ciss.jhu.edu/?page_id=67)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent Systems (SMC 2025)

The 2025 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics (SMC) is the flagship conference of the IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Society. It provides an international forum for researchers, educators, and practitioners to learn, share knowledge, report most recent innovations and developments, and exchange ideas and advances in all aspects of systems science and engineering, human-machine systems, and cybernetics. The theme of the IEEE SMC 2025 conference is “**Navigating Frontiers: Smart Systems for a Dynamic World**”.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors must adhere to the IEEE conference written paper format (including paper title, authors and affiliations, figures, and references).
*   Submit the draft version of the paper for review before the due submission deadlines via the PaperCept submission system.
*   **Templates:** Use the IEEE provided templates in MS Word and LaTeX format. Letter page size should be used. Do not modify the style or format.
    *   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc](call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc&cid=541)
    *   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip](call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip&cid=541)
*   Submit only original work, not previously published or copyrighted (including not submitted elsewhere).
*   The conference uses the CrossCheck automated screening system.
*   **Review Process:** Single-blind review process (reviewers are aware of authors' identities, but authors are unaware of reviewers' identities).
*   **Presentation:** Accepted papers must be presented at the conference, either by the authors themselves or via proxy. Non-presented papers will be considered "no-show" and removed from post-conference distribution.
*   **Publication:** Accepted and presented papers will be copyrighted to IEEE and published in conference proceedings, eligible for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library after meeting IEEE quality review requirements. They will also be submitted to Scopus for indexing.

## Submission Portal

*   [PaperCept System](https://conf.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl)

## Paper Types

*   **Regular Papers:** Full-length papers (up to 6 pages, with max. 2 overlength pages for an extra fee). Papers should be concise but contain sufficient details for critical review. Reviewed (single-blinded) by at least two referees.
*   **Special Sessions Papers:** Focused discussion of new topics. Organizers must collect at least six papers. All submitted special session papers undergo the same review process as regular papers.
*   **Work-in-Progress and Industrial Papers:** For work-in-progress and contributions from industries. Limited to four (4) pages (total length including references). Follow guidelines for regular papers.
*   **Workshop Papers:** For applied research and applications, including work in progress. Undergo the same review process as regular papers.

## Topics

Contributions are invited in theory and practice across the following areas:

### Cybernetics (CYB)

*   Agent-Based Modeling
*   Artificial Immune Systems
*   Artificial Life
*   Biometric Systems and Bioinformatics
*   Cloud IoT and Robotics Integration
*   Complex Network
*   Computational Intelligence
*   Computational Life Science
*   Cybernetics for Informatics
*   Deep Learning
*   Evolutionary Computation
*   Expert and Knowledge-Based Systems
*   Fuzzy Systems and their applications
*   Heuristic Algorithms
*   Hybrid Models of Neural Networks Fuzzy Systems and Evolutionary Computing
*   Image Processing and Pattern Recognition
*   Information Assurance and Intelligence
*   Intelligent Internet Systems
*   Knowledge Acquisition Machine Learning
*   Machine Vision
*   Media Computing
*   Medical Informatics
*   Multimedia Computation
*   Neural Networks and their Applications
*   Optimization and Self-Organization Approaches
*   Quantum Cybernetics
*   Quantum Machine Learning
*   Representation Learning
*   Swarm Intelligence
*   Transfer Learning

### Human-Machine Systems (HMS)

*   Assistive Technology
*   Augmented Cognition
*   Brain-based Information Communications
*   Design Methods
*   Entertainment Engineering
*   Human Factors
*   Human Performance Modeling
*   Human-centered Learning
*   Human-Computer Interaction
*   Human-Machine Cooperation and Systems
*   Human-Machine Interface
*   Information Systems for Design
*   Information Visualization
*   Intelligence Interaction
*   Interactive and Digital Media
*   Interactive Design Science and Engineering
*   Kansei (sense/emotion) Engineering
*   Medical Informatics
*   Multimedia Systems
*   Multi-User Interaction
*   Resilience Engineering
*   Supervisory Control Systems Safety and Security
*   Team Performance and Training Systems
*   User Interface Design
*   Virtual and Augmented Reality Systems
*   Wearable Computing

### Systems Science & Engineering (SSE)

*   Communications
*   Conflict Resolution
*   Consumer and Industrial Applications
*   Control of Uncertain Systems
*   Cooperative Systems and Control
*   Decision Support Systems
*   Discrete Event Systems
*   Distributed Intelligent Systems
*   Electric Vehicles and Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment
*   Enterprise Information Systems
*   Fault Monitoring and Diagnosis
*   Homeland Security
*   Infrastructure Systems and Services
*   Intelligent Green Production Systems
*   Intelligent Power Grid
*   Intelligent Transportation Systems
*   Large-Scale System of Systems
*   Manufacturing Automation and Systems Mechatronics
*   Quality and Reliability Engineering
*   Robotic Systems
*   Service Systems and Organizations
*   Smart Buildings, Smart Cities and Infrastructures
*   Smart Metering
*   Smart Sensor Networks
*   Soft Robotics
*   System Architecture
*   System Modeling and Control
*   Technology Assessment
*   Trust in Autonomous Systems

## Important Dates

All dates are extended deadlines:

*   **Special Session Proposal Deadline:** March 5, 2025
*   **Tutorial and Workshop Proposal Deadline:** March 5, 2025
*   **Notification of Special Session, Tutorial, and Workshop Acceptance:** March 17, 2025
*   **Regular and Special Session Paper Submission Deadline:** May 4, 2025
*   **Work in Progress and Industry Paper and Workshop Contribution Submission Deadline:** May 23, 2025
*   **Travel Grants Deadline:** May 23, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification of Papers:** June 29, 2025
*   **Final Camera-ready Submission of Papers:** July 25, 2025
*   **Early Bird Registration (author and non-author) Deadline:** July 25, 2025
*   **Late Registration (non-author) Deadline:** September 26, 2025

# CogSci 2025: Call for Papers

## Conference Overview

*   **Conference Name:** The Annual Meeting of the Cognitive Science Society
*   **Acronym:** CogSci 2025
*   **Dates:** July 30 – August 2, 2025
*   **Location:** Marriott Marquis, San Francisco, USA
*   **Participation Options:** In Person & Virtual

## Conference Themes and Keynotes

### Theme 1: The Future of Foundational Ideas of Cognitive Science
*   **Keynote:** Susan Carey (Harvard University)

### Theme 2: The Role of AI in Theories of the Future
*   **Keynote:** Josh Tenenbaum (MIT)

### Theme 3: New Theoretical Horizons in Cognitive Science
*   **Keynote:** Lauren Ross (UC Irvine)

## Key Dates

1.  **Submissions Open:** December 2, 2024
2.  **Submissions Close:** February 3, 2025
3.  **Author Notification of Acceptance:** April 2025
4.  **Accepted Submissions Due (Final Form):** May 11, 2025
5.  **Conference Prize Nominations Open:** December 2, 2024
6.  **Awards Announced:** April 2025
7.  **Conference Registration Open:** (Ongoing)
8.  **Early-Bird Registration Deadline:** June 2, 2025
9.  **Standard Registration Deadline:** July 2, 2025

## Submission Information

*   **Submissions Portal:** [https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/submissions/](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/submissions/)
*   **Submissions FAQ:** [https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/submissions-faq/](https://cognitivesciencesociety.org/submissions-faq/)

## Special Announcements

*   **Rumelhart Prize:** The 2025 recipient is Nora Newcombe (Temple University).
*   **CogSci Grove:** An initiative to mobilize cognitive scientists to offset carbon emissions associated with their professional activities.

## Program Committee

*   Azzurra Ruggeri
*   David Barner
*   Caren Walker
*   Neil Bramley

## Contact Information

*   **Conference Questions/Secretariat:** cogsci@podiumconferences.com
*   **Sponsor & Exhibitor Sales:** Tori Lunden, Podium Conference Services (tori@podiumconferences.com)
